* The fabric is made by hydroentangling a layered precursor web comprising a first fibrous matrix, a second fibrous matrix, and a median support layer or scrim.
* The support layer or scrim acts as a fiber distribution control layer, preventing excessive intermingling of the fibrous constituents of the two outer layers.
* The precursor web is formed into a three-dimensionally imaged nonwoven fabric by hydroentanglement on a three-dimensional image transfer device.
* The image transfer device defines three-dimensional elements against the precursor web, displacing the first fibrous matrix into the three-dimensional topography while retaining the second fibrous matrix on the side away from the three-dimensional topography.
* The fabric may comprise apertures of various shapes and sizes, which may extend through one or more layers of the fabric.
* The material can be used in various end-use products, including disposable absorbent hygiene articles, medical gauze, wet or dry wipes, protective wear, and apparel construction.
* The fabric exhibits improved resiliency, fuzz resistance, and loop durability, making it suitable for repeated use and attachment cycles.
* The invention provides a durable nonwoven fabric with a pronounced three-dimensional image, suitable for a wide range of applications where a combination of physical properties and aesthetic appeal is required.

<summary>
* The invention relates to a device for feeding a strip of material into a sewing machine and sewing it onto a cut of fabric, ensuring continuous operation and allowing for the use of relatively stiff strips of material.
* The device features a stop that can be moved into the feed path of the strip and retracted from it, controlling a signal transmitter that actuates the sewing machine's switching functions, including the lowering of the presser foot and the start of the sewing operation.
* The device is designed to be simple, rugged, and economical to manufacture, and can be adjusted to accommodate different types of strips and fabrics, with features such as adjustable stops and a control cam that allows for precise control over the sewing operation.

<summary>
* The invention relates to a knitting method and fabric for linking rope- or tape-shaped knit fabrics in garments such as sweaters, tank tops, and aprons.
* The traditional method of linking these fabrics involves sewing, which can be time-consuming, costly, and result in an uneven appearance.
* The invention provides a connective knitting method that eliminates the need for sewing and produces a seamless joint.
* The method uses a flat knitting machine with at least two needle beds, one of which is movable in the lateral direction.
* The two pieces of tape-shaped knit fabric are knitted simultaneously on the two needle beds, with a boundary between them.
* When the fabric reaches a specified length, the loops of the final course of one fabric are transferred to the other needle bed, and the needle bed is moved to overlay the loops.
* A new loop is formed on the overlaid portion, and the process is repeated to join the two fabrics.
* The method allows for the gradual decrease of loops on one fabric while increasing the loops on the other, resulting in a seamless joint.
* The invention can be used to link tape- or rope-shaped knit fabrics in various garments and accessories.
* The method can be controlled by a computer following a designed knitting pattern to ensure precision and consistency.

<summary>
• The invention relates to a flexible traction element, a production line, and a method for producing the traction element, which consists of at least one stranded cable embedded in a flexible thermoplastic material.
• The stranded cable has a core strand coated with a flexible thermoplastic material, and the production line includes a device for precise orientation of the stranded cables, a heater for preheating the stranded cables, an extruder for co-extrusion of the stranded cables in a flexible plastics material jacket, and a cooling trough.
• The method involves degreasing and preheating the stranded cables, sheathing them with a flexible thermoplastic material, and controlling the spacing of the stranded cables in the plastics material jacket to ensure improved adhesion and flexibility.
• The production line can produce traction elements with a wide range of dimensions and properties, including lift bands or cables with high tensile strength and electric conductivity.
• The invention provides a significant improvement over prior art, offering increased flexibility, improved adhesion, and higher production speeds, making it suitable for a variety of applications, including lifts, pulling, and storing loads.

<summary>
• The invention relates to a new and useful rotary hook arrangement for a lockstitch sewing machine, which provides a solution to the problem of thread passage gaps and impediments in previous designs.
• The invention arranges the holding means that prevent co-rotation and reverse rotation of the bobbin housing on the loop cast-off side of the bobbin housing, allowing the needle thread loop to expand unhindered until its maximum expansion is reached.
• The needle thread loop is then pulled back by the thread take-up lever, sliding along the outer surface of the bobbin housing and the front side face of the shoulder, without touching the front cam, and only briefly bending the low-mass spring rod.
• The invention eliminates the impediment of thread movement caused by the bending of the spring rod by providing a capsule release device that gives the bobbin housing a rotational impulse counter to the direction of hook rotation, creating a gap for the needle thread loop to slip through unhindered.
• The invention provides a rotary hook arrangement that is simple in design, rugged in construction, and economical to manufacture, with a low-mass spring rod that requires little force to bend, resulting in a low increase in needle thread tension.
• The invention allows for a jerk-free and low-friction motion of the needle thread loop, with the option to use a capsule release device to further reduce needle thread tension, making it suitable for a wide range of sewing applications.

<summary>
• The invention relates to materials and methods for producing silicon-based micro and nanofibers using electrospinning techniques.
• The method involves combining a liquid silane, a polymer, an accelerant, and a solvent to form a viscous solution, which is then expelled through a nozzle and exposed to a high electric field to form continuous fibers.
• The fibers are deposited onto a substrate and transformed using thermal processing or laser processing to produce polysilane-containing materials, amorphous silicon-containing materials, or crystalline silicon-containing materials.
• The liquid silane can be cyclohexasilane (Si6H12), cyclopentasilane (Si5H10), or 1-silylcyclopentasilane, and the polymer can be poly(methyl methacrylate) or a polycarbonate.
• The accelerant can be a polyhydropolysilane, which accelerates the polymerization of the liquid silane.
• The solvent can be toluene, xylene, cyclooctane, 1,2,4-trichlorobenzene, or dichloromethane, or mixtures thereof.
• The fibers can be coated with a conductive coating, such as graphite, carbon black, graphene, or carbon nanotubes, to produce a component for composite materials, such as an anode material for a lithium ion battery.
• The method can also be used to produce five-component inks by adding a solid phase component, such as a particulate, photoactive, or reactive compound, to the ink mixture.
• The invention provides a continuous and scalable method for producing silicon-based nanofibers with controlled composition and structure, which can be used in a variety of applications, including energy storage and conversion devices.

<summary>
* The invention relates to an arrangement for controlling thread tension in a spool creel with multiple spool holders, each with a brake rotor and an adjustable braking element.
* The braking element is biased by a tensioning lever that takes up an angular position dependent on thread tension and weight.
* The invention aims to provide an arrangement that allows for both global and individual control of thread tension in the creel.
* The arrangement includes a plurality of controllers, each coupled to a spool holder, and a biasing arrangement that can be activated by fluid pressure.
* The biasing arrangement influences the tensioning lever, allowing for central control of thread tension in the entire creel.
* The force generated by the biasing arrangement operates in addition to the weight force on the tensioning lever, allowing for alteration of thread tension.
* The biasing arrangement can be formed by a piston/cylinder assembly, which can follow the swinging movement of the tensioning lever without hindering its control procedure.
* The invention also includes a brake shoe that can be applied to a further braking surface under higher fluid pressures, allowing for rapid braking when the warping machine is shut off.
* The brake shoe can be held by the tensioning lever, ensuring that it is removed from contact with the further braking surface when the warping machine is restarted.
* The invention provides improved tension control in a creel arrangement, allowing for both global and individual control of thread tension, and rapid braking when needed.

<summary>
• The invention relates to a sewing machine detector that detects the position of a sewing needle and the speed of the sewing machine.
• The detector is integral with the drive and control elements of the sewing machine.
• The conventional detector has several drawbacks, including the use of curved reflective discs that are prone to vibration and stress, and the use of lead wires that can interfere with the control circuitry.
• The invention aims to overcome these drawbacks by providing a low-cost, durable, and compact detector that minimizes stress on the optical fibers.
• The detector uses flat, sheet-shaped light shielding discs that are mounted coaxially to a shaft connected to the sewing machine shaft.
• The light shielding discs have light-transmitting areas and light-shielding areas that are printed with different colors to indicate different signals.
• The detector uses optical fibers that are supported linearly, reducing stress and allowing for accurate optical axes to be generated.
• The invention also includes a power indicating cable that runs simultaneously with the optical fibers for detection, simplifying the construction and eliminating interference with the control circuitry.
• The detector can detect multiple signals, including needle UP position, needle DOWN position, speed detection, and thread trimmer timing position.
• The invention provides a stable and accurate detection of sewing machine control signals despite shaft vibration and wear.

<summary>
* The invention relates to a simplified process for the continuous production of viscose rayon yarns with a high degree of whiteness, without sacrificing quality or increasing production time.
* The process involves completing coagulation of the yarn, followed by a washing treatment with water having a non-alkaline pH, to remove impurities and achieve a high degree of whiteness.
* The washing treatment is critical, and the water used must have a pH between 4.0 and 5.5, and be free from certain cations in excess of specified amounts.
* The process can be carried out at high spinning speeds, and the yarn produced has excellent mechanical properties and a high degree of whiteness, without the need for additional bleaching or finishing treatments.
* The invention offers several advantages over traditional processes, including reduced production time, lower costs, and simplified processing steps.
* The process has been demonstrated to produce yarns with a high degree of whiteness, and the inventors believe that the reduction of sulphur from sulphides is a key factor in achieving this result.

<summary>
• The invention relates to a system for deaerating pulp after oxygen bleaching, which is a critical step in the pulp bleaching process.
• The deaeration tank is designed to be small, with a diameter similar to that of the oxygen reactor, and can be placed on top of the reactor.
• The tank has an inlet pipe, an outlet, and a tangential swirl inducing inlet pipe, which provide optimum deaeration.
• The swirl inducing fluid is the filtrate from the washer after the oxygen bleach.
• The deaeration tank is designed to operate at atmospheric pressure or under low pressure or vacuum, and can be closed to recover steam or oxygen.
• The pulp is carried into the tank through the inlet pipe and splashes against the side of the tank, draining down to the body of the slurry.
• The height of the slurry in the tank is controlled by a sensor, which operates a valve to control the flow of pulp out of the tank.
• The filtrate from the washer is used to swirl the pulp in the tank, with a velocity of 6.1 meters per second (20 feet per second) at a 2% pulp consistency.
• The system is designed to be compact and efficient, with a small footprint and low energy requirements.

<summary>
* The invention relates to biomimetic tendon-reinforced (BTR) composite materials with improved properties, including high out-plane stiffness and strength-to-weight ratio, designed using a function-oriented material design (FOMD) process.
* The BTR composite structure consists of stuffer members, tendon elements, and panels, which can be arranged in various configurations, including flat, curved, and spherical shapes, and can be embedded in a matrix material for added strength.
* The FOMD process uses topology optimization to design materials for specific functions, such as supporting static loads, dissipating vibration energy, or absorbing impact energy, and can result in innovative structural material concepts, including the BTR composite.
* The BTR composite has potential applications in various fields, including aerospace, automotive, and marine industries, and can be used to fabricate lightweight yet rigid structures, such as body parts, armor, and other components.

<summary>
• The invention relates to a load-limiting device for braced frames that can dissipate energy during dynamic events, such as earthquakes, by undergoing plastic deformation, thereby limiting the loads transmitted to other parts of the structure.
• The device is designed to be replaceable after plastic deformation, allowing for easy maintenance and repair of the structure, and can be integrated into existing braced frame systems.
• The load-limiting device can be manufactured in various shapes and sizes to accommodate different structural applications and can be connected to the frame using various connection means, such as high-strength bolts or welds.
• The device is designed to undergo plastic deformation in response to high loads, forming plastic hinges that dissipate energy and limit the loads transmitted to other parts of the structure, thereby preventing damage and catastrophic failure.

<summary>
• The invention relates to a bedroom cabinet designed for use in a flophouse or temporary accommodation, providing a private space for individuals with a bed, storage, and amenities like a TV and interphone.
• The cabinet has a dual construction with an outer casing and an inner casing, allowing for a clearance between them to house wiring, ventilation, and shelves for storage, without protruding into the living space.
• The outer casing is composed of upper and lower parts that are assembled together, with a notch in each part forming an exit when combined, and flanges that abut to secure the parts together.
• The inner casing is composed of six panels, including a front panel with an opening for the exit, and is designed to provide a comfortable living space with amenities like a TV shelf, interphone, and storage boxes.
• The invention also provides for ventilation and soundproofing through the use of vent holes, recesses, and a clearance between the outer and inner casings, which can be used to house wiring and other utilities.

<summary>
* The invention relates to a portable guard rail support and assembly for use in erecting a safety barrier at construction sites, particularly in high-rise building construction, to prevent falls and ensure worker safety. The guard rail support consists of a base plate, upright column, rail supporting brackets, kick board retaining flange, angular brace, and safety tie-off ring.
* The invention provides a simple, efficient, and cost-effective solution for constructing a safety barrier, allowing for easy installation and removal, and reducing liability due to inadequate re-installation of guard rails. The guard rail support and assembly can be used in various applications, including construction sites, roof structures, and bridge construction.

<summary>
* The invention relates to a method and apparatus for stimulating crude oil reservoirs to enhance oil production using a combination of pulsed power electrohydraulic and electromagnetic methods.
* The invention builds upon the teachings of U.S. Pat. No. 4,345,650 issued to Wesley, which discloses a device for electrohydraulic recovery of crude oil using an electrohydraulic spark discharge generated in a producing formation in a well.
* The present invention uses a coupled process of direct EH acoustic vibrations and electromagnetically-induced high-frequency acoustic vibrations to stimulate oil production.
* The EH acoustic pulse travels at a finite speed from the well where the pulse originates, and the EM-induced vibrations only occur for a short time after the electrohydraulic or electromagnetic pulse is initiated.
* A multi-level discharge device can be used to extend the effective range of the stimulation by firing several sources in one well in a time sequence that is optimized to allow continuous electromagnetic-coupled stimulation of a large reservoir volume.
* Multiple pulse sources can be placed in multiple wells to act as an array that will stimulate production of the oil in a given direction or specific volume of the reservoir.
* The discharge characteristics of the pulse sources can be customized to produce specific frequencies that will achieve optimal stimulation by activating specific scales of inclusions in the reservoir.
* The invention also includes the use of EM pulse sources that do not generate a direct acoustic shock pulse, which can be used in more sensitive wells that will not tolerate the strong shock effect of an EH pulse generator.
* The invention further includes improvements to the electrodes designed for electrohydraulic stimulation, such as improved alloys, feeding devices for exploding filaments, and gas injection through a hollow electrode.

<summary>
• The present disclosure relates to a splice for extending the length of a soil reinforcing element used in Mechanically Stabilized Earth (MSE) structures, such as retaining walls, bridge abutments, and seawalls.
• The splice includes two wave plates with transverse protrusions that receive and seat transverse wires from the soil reinforcing element and a grid-strip, and perforations that allow a connective device to couple the plates together.
• The connective device, such as a bolt or threaded rod, extends through the perforations and clamps down on the longitudinal wires of the soil reinforcing element and grid-strip, preventing them from escaping the splice.
• The splice allows multiple grid-strips to be connected to a single soil reinforcing element, enabling the creation of a composite soil reinforcing element that can achieve a desired reinforcing distance from a vertical facing.
• The spacing of the transverse wires on the soil reinforcing element and grid-strip can be equal or irregular, and the longitudinal wires of the soil reinforcing element and grid-strip can be laterally offset from each other.
• The splice can be secured using a nut and washer or other attachment methods, and can be used in various MSE applications where extended lengths of soil reinforcing elements are required.

<summary>
* The invention relates to a plow blade with a fluid passage and points of fluid ejection, designed to reduce the power required to pull the plow through the ground by lubricating the sides of the blade and chute with fluid, and can be tailored to match specific job requirements.
* The plow blade is constructed with a multiple component assembly, allowing for easy replacement of worn parts, and can be manufactured using traditional processes, with the flow paths defined by stacking together leading edge sections with flow voids and welding or attaching them to the blade.

<summary>
* The invention relates to a building system, particularly stucco type cavity wall construction techniques and materials, allowing for larger panels without movement control joints.
* The system includes a frame or substructure, battens, inner and outer meshes, and a plaster matrix applied in multiple layers.
* The inner mesh is attached to the battens, and the outer mesh is supported by the plaster matrix, which penetrates the inner mesh and embeds the outer mesh.
* The system can create panels of at least 2.4m high and 4m wide, with no movement control joints, and can be used to build walls of various shapes and sizes.
* The invention also includes methods for in situ formation of reinforced plaster panels, including preparing the support structure, applying plaster, and embedding the outer mesh.
* The system can be used to create building structures with intersecting walls, and includes flashing members to manage water and weatherproofing.
* The invention also includes side jamb and sill flashed window or door assemblies, and head flashed window or door assemblies, designed to work with the stucco type building structure.
* The system is designed to meet or exceed building codes and regulations, such as NZS3604 and NZS4251, and can be used to create buildings with various shapes, sizes, and features.

<summary>
* The invention relates to a safe and door structure, particularly a floor safe, with a valuables receiving chamber and a door that can be inserted and removed from the chamber.
* The door is designed to be secured in place by a lockbolt that engages a notch in the safe's wall, and is reinforced by safety bolts to prevent lateral movement and protect the lock mechanism from damage.
* The safe's walls are configured with grooves that receive the door's edges, with one groove being deeper than the other, allowing the door to be inserted at an angle and then shifted into place.
* The invention provides a simple and effective door and safe construction that can be used in various applications, including floor safes and preassembled steel safes, and offers improved security and protection against forced entry.

<summary>
* The invention relates to a method and system for measuring fluid pressure in a subterranean formation, which involves installing a pressure sensor arrangement in a borehole and creating a fluid connection between the sensor and the formation through a cement grout and a filter, allowing for accurate measurement of the formation pressure.
* The system can be installed in a single operation, and the pressure sensor can be relocated or removed for maintenance or calibration, and the method can be used in various applications, including groundwater monitoring, oil and gas exploration, and coal seam gas extraction.

<summary>
• The invention relates to a jointing structure in vehicle traveling path joints and the like having an expansion function, which is adaptable for applications of various tire configurations different in tire diameter, ensures high slip resistance to tires, permits less occurrence of tire fallen-in and/or stuck-in situations, and is easy to be given maintenance.
• The jointing structure comprises more than one step provided face to face at the coaxially built traveling path ends with an expansion gap between, more than one elastic member respectively mounted inside the above more than one step, and a joint block mounted on the above more than one elastic member across the above expansion gap.
• The elastic members are designed to be hard to be deformed vertically and easy to be deformed horizontally in a soft manner, and are mounted in detachable fashion to the steps and the joint block, allowing for easy maintenance.
• The joint block is mounted across the expansion gap, preventing the occurrence of tire fallen-in and/or stuck-in situations, and is designed to be adaptable to various tire configurations and to ensure high slip resistance to tires.
• The invention also provides a method of mounting an elastic member, which involves joining the elastic members together across the expansion gap, fixing one side of the elastic member to one step, deforming the elastic member towards the bridge girder axis, and then fixing the other side of the elastic member to the other step.

<summary>
• The invention relates to track transport systems, specifically floor track systems used in sanitary fluid treatment chambers for transporting food products on wheeled hand trucks.
• In meat processing, cooked meat products are typically cooled using air or fluid treatment chambers, but air chilling can cause dehydration and shrinkage, while fluid treatment chambers require a large volume of water and can be contaminated by the wheels of hand trucks.
• The invention aims to provide a floor transport system that prevents the wheels of hand trucks from contaminating the treatment fluid, allowing for the reuse of the fluid without reprocessing.
• The invention provides an enclosed floor track system for use in fluid treatment chambers, which prevents showered fluid from entering the wheel channel area and becoming contaminated by the truck wheels.
• The system includes a wheel channel with opposed sidewalls, one of which extends upwardly more than the other, and a cover plate that overlies the top of the channel, preventing fluid from entering the channel.
• The cover plate can be hinged to facilitate cleaning of the channel, and the system can be pitched to drain away liquid.
• Another embodiment of the invention uses inflatable elastomer seals to enclose the interior wheel channel of the track, preventing fluid from entering the channel and becoming contaminated by the truck wheels.
• The seals are attached to the sidewalls of the channel and can be inflated to fit snugly around the wheel struts, preventing fluid from entering the channel, and can be deflated to allow movement of the hand truck.
• The invention allows for the recovery and reuse of the brine solution, preserving natural resources and achieving an economic advantage.
• The enclosed floor track system can be used in various industries, not just meat processing, and can be adapted for use with different types of transport vehicles.

<summary>
* The invention relates to a lock device for a work machine, specifically a backhoe, that prevents the boom from tilting or falling due to its weight or external factors.
* The lock device consists of an engaging member (lock plate) and an engaged member (lock pin) that engage with each other to lock the boom in place, and a guide member that guides the lock plate during operation.
* The lock plate is designed to slide along a slot and rotate to engage with the lock pin, and is guided by the guide member to prevent ricketiness and ensure smooth operation.
* The invention provides a simple and reliable lock device that can be easily operated and maintained, and prevents accidents caused by the boom tilting or falling during transportation or storage.

<summary>
• The invention relates to a swimming pool vacuum cleaning device with a flexible platform that allows for adjustable suction efficiency during pool cleaning operations.
• The device features a central suction portion that can be adjusted relative to the pool bottom to regulate suction, with adjustment mechanisms located on top of the suction head for easy operation.
• The adjustment mechanisms allow for precise regulation of suction without the need to adjust the suction source, and can be added to existing pool cleaning devices with minimal modifications.
• The device includes a frame member that spans the platform, with legs that receive axles that rotatably carry rollers, and a connector that allows for vertical adjustment of the axles and rollers.
• The invention can be sold in kit form for use with existing suction head assemblies, and can be easily assembled with minimal modifications to the existing device.

<summary>
* The invention relates to an apparatus for retrieving a wear bushing from a well head and casing during oil and gas well drilling operations.
* The wear bushing is used to protect the well head and casing from wear caused by the drill pipe during drilling.
* The apparatus consists of a sub-unit with a mandrel section and a retriever section that can be slidably engaged onto the mandrel section.
* The retriever section has a plurality of protruding members that engage with a J-slot on the wear bushing to retrieve it.
* The sub-unit can be threadably engaged between two sections of drill pipe, allowing the apparatus to be used without retrieving the drill bit from the hole.
* The retriever section is free to move vertically along the mandrel section, but is prevented from rotating due to the engagement of insertion members with grooves on the mandrel section.
* This allows the retriever section to "float" along the mandrel section, preventing damage to the wear bushing or the apparatus due to the weight of the drill string.
* The apparatus can be used to retrieve the wear bushing without rotating the drill string, reducing the risk of damage to the well head or casing.
* An additional embodiment of the retriever section has a threaded lower end section that can be used to retrieve a wear bushing with a threaded collar section.
* The invention provides a simple and inexpensive solution for retrieving wear bushings during oil and gas well drilling operations.

<summary>
* The invention relates to downhole vibratory tools that allow passage of other tools therethrough, particularly those used to dislodge stuck objects (fish) in deviated wellbores.
* Prior art vibratory tools had limitations, including no central passageway for wireline operations, dump valves that slammed against seats, and limited power delivery.
* The present invention addresses these issues with a reconfigured dump valve, modular stacked pistons, and a removable plug that allows wireline access.
* The tool has a central passage that can be closed by landing a plug on a seat, and the dump valve is disposed annularly about the passage.
* The modular piston stack allows for increased power delivery and can be configured to match the power required for the particular work string or downhole conditions.
* The tool can be operated to deliver high-amplitude, low-frequency oscillating forces without impacts, or with impacts on each cycle.
* The design eliminates significant cyclical impacts on the valve and allows for the use of beefier springs and more reliable components.
* The tool can be used in stimulation or fishing operations and provides large amplitude vibrations in a tubing string.
* The invention allows for wireline access through the tool before the plug is dropped, and the plug is simple and cheap with no moving parts.
* The tool can be configured to operate with or without impacts, and the power stroke can be engaged near the upper end of piston movement to stay in phase with the oscillating string or fish.

<summary>
* The invention relates to a precast concrete retaining wall system with a face panel and a base, where the face panel has an integral counterfort that extends from the rear side of the panel.
* The counterfort provides additional support to the wall and allows for taller walls with shorter bases, and can have openings for drainage to reduce hydrostatic pressure.
* The face panel and base are precast concrete modules that are connected on-site using rebars and grout, eliminating the need for temporary shoring.
* The system can be customized to accommodate different soil conditions, including the use of H-piles or a cast-in-place pile cap for added stability.
* The wall system can also be designed with a vehicle impact barrier, which can be cast-in-place or precast, and can be located on top of or behind the wall.

<summary>
* The present invention relates to systems and methods for producing or delivering heat at or near the down hole end of production tubing of a producing oil or gas well to improve production.
* The invention addresses two primary shortcomings of conventional approaches to heating oil and paraffin down hole: (1) the heat is not properly focused where it needs to be, and (2) existing down hole heaters fail due to lack of design elements that protect electrical components from chemical or physical attack.
* The invention provides a down hole heating system that focuses heat in the production zone to promote flow to, and not just within, the production tubing, and protects electrical components from damage and electrical shorts.
* The system includes a heat insulating packer, perforated tubing, a stainless steel tubing collar, and a heating unit with electrical resistance type heater rods, cables, and leads.
* The heating unit is designed to contain heat in the production zone and prevent heat loss through conduction, and the electrical connections are shielded from pressure and hostile chemical agents to prevent electrical problems.
* The invention also includes a method for using the system to heat-treat an oil or gas well for improving well flow, which can be used in conjunction with other well treatments or maintenance.

<summary>
• The invention relates to a downhole tool for conducting mechanical activities in wells, specifically a mechanism for installing and removing objects in wells, including stuck or lost objects, with a simple and efficient latching and unlatching system.
• The tool features an outer tubular body and an inner body structure that can move relative to each other, with a catch mechanism that allows for controlled latching and unlatching of the tool to the object being retrieved.
• The latching and unlatching system uses guide pins and springs to control the movement of the inner and outer bodies, allowing for repeated latching and unlatching cycles without the need for removal from the well bore.
• The invention can be used for a variety of downhole service operations, including installation and removal of downhole tools and fishing operations for stuck or lost tools, and can be adapted for use with different types of objects and well bore conditions.

<summary>
• The present invention relates to stave floors, particularly modular composed stave floors, and provides a method for their manufacture.
• Conventional composed stave floors have drawbacks, including a thin sight substrate that can deform or detach, and a long cure time for the glue.
• The sight substrate is typically 2-3 mm thick and is prone to deformation or detachment when sanded or rushed.
• The base substrate is usually composed of slung wood or triplay, and is joined to the sight substrate using glue, which can lead to deformations and changes in dimension.
• The invention aims to preserve the physical, aesthetic, and functional properties of the sight substrate and provide a longer lifespan for the floor.
• The invention uses a sight substrate with a minimum thickness of 4 mm and a base substrate with a minimum thickness of 12 mm.
• The substrates are assembled using glue and multidirectional holding means, including dendrites, adhesion, and horizontal and vertical reinforcement means.
• The invention provides improved composed stave floors with a longer lifespan and the ability to undergo corrective maintenance.
• The floors can be supplied pre-varnished with a glaze, such as aluminum oxide, which provides higher hardness without affecting the aesthetic appearance.
• The invention offers a solution to the problems of conventional composed stave floors, including deformation, detachment, and short lifespan.

<summary>
• The invention relates to ladder attachments that improve the stability and grip of ladders on work surfaces, preventing damage to the surface and ensuring user safety.
• The attachment features a brace assembly with a flange, U-bolt, and resilient pad that can be attached to the ladder's siderails and rungs, providing a broad contact area with the work surface.
• The attachment allows the ladder to straddle corners and provides lateral stability, preventing the ladder from slipping or sliding on the work surface.
• The resilient pad assembly is pivotally connected to the arm, enabling it to adapt to different work surfaces and corners, and providing a non-slip grip without damaging the surface.
• The attachment can be installed on various types of ladders, including aluminum and fiberglass ladders, and can be adjusted to accommodate different ladder sizes and configurations.
• The invention provides a solution to common problems associated with ladder use, including instability, damage to work surfaces, and difficulty working on corners, making it a valuable innovation in the field of ladder technology.

<summary>
* The invention relates to a collated fastener assembly with a plastic material molded onto and adhered to the fasteners, which reduces debris generation during driving into a substrate.
* The plastic material is formulated from an adhesive polymer, such as a polyolefin, polyolefin blend, epoxy, or the like, and is molded onto the fasteners at an elevated temperature to enhance adhesion.
* The collation system includes a collar portion that captures or encircles the fastener shank and a connecting portion that extends between and connects adjacent collar portions, with a bridge and rib structure that provides rigidity and facilitates separation of the fastener from the strip.
* The connecting portion can be formed with a preferentially weakened region, such as a notch, to influence separation of the connecting portion from the collar at a desired location, reducing debris generation.
* The nail strip can be configured with upper and lower collations of different widths, and the collar can be tapered or thinned at the leading edge to facilitate penetration into the substrate.
* The invention provides a collated fastener assembly with improved adhesion, reduced debris generation, and increased holding power in the substrate.

<summary>
* The invention relates to a nozzle for applying sealants, such as silicones, in various industries like aviation, automotive, naval, railway, and robotics.
* The nozzle has a bell or hood-shaped lower section and an injection button with a special design, allowing for precise application of sealants around rivets and nuts.
* The nozzle can be used with both manual cartridges and automatic injection machines, and its design allows for easy cleaning and reuse.
* The bell-shaped section is designed to encapsulate rivets or nuts, and the injection button has channels and orifices for guiding the sealant flow.
* The nozzle can be connected to most cartridges or machines containing sealant, and the protruding ring acts as a stopper for precise adjustment.
* The sealant enters the nozzle through the threaded hollow section and is expelled through the bell-shaped section and injection button.
* The injection button can be fitted or removed from the bell-shaped section at will, allowing for different precision sealing operations.
* The nozzle allows for the application of sealants in a precise and controlled manner, reducing the risk of leakage and ensuring a perfect seal.
* The invention provides a device that simplifies the sealing work, reduces application time, and increases the quality of the resulting sealant application.
* The nozzle can be used for various applications, including sealing rivets and nuts, and can be used in conjunction with other sealing materials, such as sealing cords and filler sealants.

<summary>
• The invention relates to a position sensor that can multiplex multiple sensors on a minimum number of wires with a minimum of energy required from each sensor monitoring system.
• The sensor includes a waveform generator and an error correction generator that modifies a sensing signal by removing unneeded power and providing the signal to a remote monitor via two wires.
• The error correction generator determines and eliminates strong static signals and error signals that do not deliver information about the position of an object being sensed, which would otherwise waste energy.
• The sensor includes a digitally stored offset and error correction closed-loop compensation circuit that constantly compares the sensor output to a desired minimum value and generates a correction signal to deliver a sensor output close to the desired minimum value.
• The sensor can operate in a first direction to eliminate small values of drift in a negative going direction and in a second direction to subtract signals generated by errors or noise sources from the sensor output.
• The sensor can be connected to a sensor monitoring system through a current-to-voltage converter resistor and a power supply, and can modulate a current across a pair of wires connected to the sensor monitoring system.

<summary>
• The invention relates to a valve actuation system for internal combustion engines, specifically a desmodromic valve actuation system that is springless and infinitely variable.
• The system uses a reciprocating cam translating device coupled to a rotary cam, which receives input from a timing belt driven by the engine crankshaft.
• The system eliminates the need for springs and allows for precise control of valve opening and closing, enabling more efficient engine performance and fuel consumption.
• The valve actuation system can be controlled by a computer, allowing for real-time adjustments to valve opening and closing based on engine performance and operating conditions.
• The system can be used to control individual cylinders, allowing for cylinder deactivation and improved fuel efficiency.
• The invention also includes a methodology for controlling the valve actuation system, including a control block that captures the adjustment pin and maintains parallelism with the line of action of the slide assembly.
• The system can be integrated with a four-valve cylinder assembly, allowing for precise control of all four valves.
• The invention provides a robust and simple assembly that can be used in a variety of internal combustion engine applications, including automotive and industrial engines.

<summary>
* The invention relates to aquarium lighting, specifically a light member with a housing and a lighting control region that includes multiple control channels for controlling different colors of light.
* The light member includes one or more light-emitting modules that are releasably coupled to the lighting control region and can be positioned anywhere along the region.
* Each module includes LEDs that emit a specific color of light, and the modules can be controlled independently to create a range of color temperatures and effects.
* The light member can include multiple lighting control regions, and each region can be controlled by a separate switch or timer.
* The invention also includes a remote control module that can be controlled remotely using radio frequency (RF) signals, and a single in-line timer that can control multiple channels.
* The light member can be used not only for aquariums but also for other applications such as underneath office or kitchen cabinets to provide lighting.

<summary>
* The invention relates to a cooled flow deflection apparatus for a fluid-flow machine, particularly a gas turbine, which operates at high temperatures.
* The prior art apparatus has cast separating walls and deflection devices, which have disadvantages such as difficult cooling, thermal stresses, high blade weight, and complex casting.
* The invention provides a cooled flow deflection apparatus with separate inserts, which are not cast with the apparatus, but are inserted and secured afterwards, to bound the cooling channels.
* The inserts can be made of metal or non-metal materials and have advantages such as reduced material in the transitional region, no thermal stresses, reduced blade weight, and simplified casting.
* The inserts can be easily replaced to adjust the cooling system, and can be secured by an integral material joint, such as soldering or welding.
* A preferred embodiment of the invention is a hollow casting with holders in the form of rails, into which the separating walls are inserted, which simplifies assembly and attachment of the inserts.
* Another embodiment is a blade in a gas turbine, where the cooling channels and separating walls extend essentially in the radial direction, and the inserted separating walls are connected by an integral material joint to the blade.
* The invention provides a cooled flow deflection apparatus that is simple to produce, can be flexibly matched to the respective application, and is efficiently cooled.

<summary>
* The invention relates to a system and method for controlling a fuel delivery system in a vehicle, which can be switched between automatic and manual control, allowing the vehicle to be operated safely and efficiently in various driving conditions.
* The system comprises a control unit that receives signals from the accelerator pedal and throttle valve, and processes them to provide a control signal to a DC motor or stepper motor that sets the throttle valve position for optimum performance, and also provides an output signal to control a clutch that connects the accelerator pedal directly to the throttle valve for manual control.
* The system allows for smooth transition between automatic and manual control, without causing the vehicle to lurch forward or stall, and provides full operation of the vehicle in manual mode, making it suitable for use in conjunction with a continuously variable transmission.

<summary>
• The invention relates to a waste fuel burner that generates heat from particulate-laden gas or waste fuels like wood waste, with minimal environmental pollution.
• The burner produces exhaust gases as clean as those from oil and gas burners, making it suitable for use in various industrial applications.
• The invention achieves this by forming a conical pile of waste fuel, fed from below, with preheated underfire air percolating up through the pile, drying and gasifying the fuel.
• The volatile gases are then partially oxidized in a primary combustion chamber with controlled amounts of swirl air, which also forces particulate out of the gas stream.
• The gases then enter a secondary combustion chamber where additional combustion air is introduced to complete combustion, with the air directed tangentially to maintain a high temperature and swirl.
• The burner can burn wet wood with up to 70% moisture content and produces minimal slag or clinkers.
• The invention is self-regulating, easy to control, and has fast response times to changes in load, comparable to conventional gas and oil burners.
• The burner can be used with various types of fuels and can be added to any source of dirty particulate-laden combustible gas to provide a clean source of heat.
• The invention includes a unique flame holder that serves as a barrier to prevent particulate from entering the secondary combustion chamber and allows for centrifugal separation of particulate from the gas stream.
• The control system for the burner is designed to maintain optimal operating conditions, with overrides and trims provided for swirl air and secondary air quantities to ensure efficient and clean combustion.

<summary>
* The invention is an evaporative cooler system that uses a heat exchanger to cool air without adding moisture, achieving sensible cooling. The system draws a major portion of the working air from the room to be cooled, which has a lower wet bulb temperature than outside air, to maximize the temperature differential and cooling efficiency.
* The system can be configured in various ways, including a hybrid system that incorporates a vapor compression refrigeration unit to further cool a portion of the air stream, allowing for dehumidification and additional cooling, and can achieve higher efficiencies and lower energy consumption compared to traditional vapor compression refrigeration units.

<summary>
* The invention relates to a fluid pump capable of pumping fluids at high volumetric flow rate and high pressure, particularly for pumping liquid manure from a reservoir.
* The pump consists of two or more pump heads connected in series, each pump head having an impeller and a housing with multiple fluid conduits that combine to form a single flow of fluid.
* The pump heads are connected by a drive structure that commonly drives the impellers, allowing for high pressure and flow rate.
* The pump can be configured with multiple pump heads to increase operating pressure, and the pump heads can be modularly connected and disconnected for maintenance and repair.
* The pump can be mounted on a support structure, such as a wheeled boom, hitching assembly, or trailer, to facilitate operation at a fluid reservoir.
* The pump can include features such as agitator nozzles to encourage mixing of the fluid in the reservoir, and can be powered by a motor unit.
* The pump's design allows for efficient and reliable operation, with features such as biconical tubular connectors and bell-shaped caps to prevent fluid from entering the drive train and protect the drive shafts from corrosion and befouling.

<summary>
• The invention relates to engine compression release brakes, particularly those used in engines with less than all engine cylinders.
• Traditional engine compression release brake systems typically include an engine brake for each engine cylinder, but this can result in excess components if not all cylinders are used for braking.
• The present invention aims to reduce the number of components by providing an engine compression release brake system with a sufficient, but reduced, number of components.
• The system includes an engine housing defining a plurality of engine cylinders, with an engine compression release brake provided for each of a portion of the engine cylinders, which is less than all of the plurality of engine cylinders.
• The engine compression release brake is operably coupled to a cam actuated exhaust valve and can be activated during the compression stroke of the piston to vent compressed air from the cylinder.
• The brake system includes a hydraulic system, an electronic control module, and a solenoid-actuated valve that controls the flow of high-pressure fluid to the brake.
• The system can be used in a variety of engines, including four-cycle diesel engines, and can be modified to accommodate different numbers of cylinders and braking horsepower requirements.
• The modularity of the system allows customers to choose and pay for only the amount of braking horsepower they desire for a specific application.
• The invention provides a more efficient and cost-effective engine compression release brake system compared to traditional systems.

<summary>
• The invention relates to a mounting link between an engine structure and an attached structure, such as an auxiliary gearbox, designed to withstand extreme loads, including those caused by "blade-off" events.
• The mounting link includes a male link, a female link, and a pin that selectively retains the male and female links, allowing for translation and radial interface damping.
• The radial interface between the male and female links provides coulomb damping to dissipate energy created by translation.
• The pin is designed to shear at a known load magnitude, allowing the male and female links to translate relative to each other and limiting damage to the gearbox and peripherals.
• The mounting link is designed to absorb extreme shocks without detaching the gearbox from the engine or transmitting destructive loads.
• The female link receives the male link, allowing for translation and forming a radial interface that dampens translation.
• The pin is releasably coupled to the male and female links, selectively retaining them and allowing for translation when the pin is sheared.
• The mounting link can be used to connect the engine to an associated structure, such as a gearbox, and can rigidly constrain one degree of freedom between the engine and the gearbox.
• The invention provides a solution that obviates the need for all linkages and peripheral connections to be capable of surviving extreme loads, reducing weight and material requirements.
• The pin can be replaced with an intact pin during maintenance following a shock sufficient to break the pin.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to archery equipment, specifically apparatus and methods for attaching arrow points and nocks to arrow shafts and balancing arrow shafts, with improvements over prior art, including reducing stress on the shaft, preventing dirt entry, and allowing for adjustable weight and balance.
* The invention includes a point cap system with a small, lightweight design that can be adjusted in weight to achieve perfect balance, and a balance pin that can be trimmed to desired length to obtain exact point weight, ensuring arrow balance.
* The invention also includes a point adaptor and nock cap adaptor that can be adhesively attached to the arrow shaft, providing a means of attachment that is suited to the use of unidirectional fiber reinforced shafts, and reducing cross-fiber stress at the end of the shaft.

<summary>
• The invention is a small arms firing effect simulator that simulates the sound and flash of small arms fire without modifying the weapon or using mechanical actuation.
• The simulator uses a low-cost plastic expendable housing a metal/oxidizer pyrotechnic in conjunction with an electrical ignition system to produce a realistic simulation of small arms fire noise and flash.
• The expendable contains multiple rounds and is installed in a firing unit that can be inserted into the weapon via the magazine breech, and produces sound and flash by electrically igniting the pyrotechnic in a confined space and venting the combustion products through the weapon's ejection port.
• The electrical control circuit provides for automatic and semiautomatic fire, and interfaces with the weapon trigger and bolt, and includes a firing sensor that detects when a pyrotechnic charge has fired and resets the oscillator control circuit.
• The simulator is packaged to resemble a magazine clip and can be used with an M16 rifle and a MILES (Multiple Integrated Laser Engagement System) unit, and is designed to be reusable and low maintenance.
• The invention provides a cost-effective means of providing realistic training using an actual weapon, and can be used to simulate small arms fire without the danger of pressurizing the ignition chamber.

<summary>
• The present invention relates to an air intake device for an internal combustion engine that utilizes the dynamic effects of air flow to improve volumetric efficiency and reduce noise from the air intake.
• The device comprises a tank, two pipes of different cross-sectional areas, and a valve that opens or closes in response to engine operating conditions, allowing for optimal performance and noise reduction.
• The invention addresses the trade-off between dynamic effect and noise level by providing a resonator effect through the tank and narrow passage, which absorbs noise, and by optimizing the valve operation based on engine speed and load.
• The valve operation is controlled by a control circuit that takes into account engine speed, load, and throttle position to produce a control signal for the solenoid valve, ensuring optimal performance and noise reduction under various engine operating conditions.

<summary>
• The invention is a two-part bracket assembly for mounting speakers or other equipment to a pole, flat surface, or other structure, allowing for easy installation by one person and adjustable positioning of the equipment.
• The bracket assembly consists of a stationary bracket and an adjustable bracket, which can be connected and secured together using a series of hooks, tabs, and screws, and can be mounted to a pole or flat surface using a pole clamp assembly or other mounting means.

<summary>
* The invention relates to a combustion apparatus, specifically a burner that can be part of a system with interchangeable or modular heat utilizing appliances, such as cooking grills, cooktops, food smoking apparatus, space heaters, and pyrolyzers.
* The burner has a combustion chamber with a fuel holder, air inlet, and exhaust outlet, and is designed to optimize efficiency and minimize unburned fuel emissions.
* The burner has a shroud that provides a flow path for tertiary combustion air, and a pivotally coupled ash pan and food grate, as well as a cover that can be closed to prevent accidental ingress of objects or exposure to heat and exhaust fumes.
* The burner can be coupled to various modular heat utilizing appliances, such as cookers, smokers, space heaters, and pyrolyzers, using a detachable coupling system.
* The pyrolyzer appliance can be used to pyrolyze carboniferous materials, such as vegetation, and includes a heating chamber, condenser, and heat exchanger to recover vaporized liquid products of pyrolysis.

<summary>
* The invention relates to a rotary internal combustion engine with a water cooling system, focusing on improving fuel economy and durability by reducing thermal distortion and cracking in the engine housing.
* The traditional in-line arrangement of spark plug bosses in the water jacket passageway disrupts cooling fluid flow, causing vapor films to collect and preventing heat extraction.
* The invention proposes a staggered arrangement of spark plug bosses, offset from the centerplane of the water jacket passageway, to improve cooling flow and reduce thermal distortion.
* The staggered arrangement allows for separate flow paths for vapor release from each boss, reducing locally high thermal conditions and improving coolant velocity distribution around the boss surfaces.
* The invention also incorporates flow diverters or controllers between the spark plug bosses to ensure a controlled flow regime and strengthen the housing structure.
* The spark plug terminals are arranged to project onto the trochoid wall, offset from the centerline, to maintain an in-line arrangement on the gas side of the wall while allowing for the staggered boss arrangement.
* The invention improves the heat transfer coefficient between the cooling flow and the spark plug bosses, increasing it by up to 44% in model studies.
* The staggered arrangement reduces thermal gradients across the width of the gas side of the wall, making the temperature distribution more uniform and flat.

<summary>
• The invention relates to a method of minimizing flow disturbance caused by the closing and reopening of turbine control valves during periodic operational testing, using control valve positions as feedback to maintain constant total mass flow through several parallel turbine inlet flow control valves.
• The method involves calculating the total mass flow for N parallel flow valves as a function of control valve position (valve stem lift), and determining the flow characteristic for each valve of the system with N valves and with N-1 valves during design.
• The flow difference characteristic between the N and N-1 condition is used to compensate for the loss of flow through the closed valve, by adjusting the flow through the remaining open valves to maintain a constant total mass flow.
• The invention uses a test compensation circuit that includes a test compensation array, a sample and hold circuit, a multiplier circuit, and a summing circuit to calculate the flow compensation required for the valves not under test.
• The method and system of the invention have been tested and shown to reduce pressure excursion of the turbine inlet main steam pressure by 95% during control valve testing, compared to not using flow compensation.

<summary>
• The invention relates to a mixing valve for an aircraft cleaning apparatus that combines fluids from two separate sources into one mixture, with a outlet mixture ranging from 0% of one fluid to 100% of the other fluid.
• The valve system has two inlets, one for soap solution and one for water, and one outlet, and is designed for use in commercial aircraft cleaning.
• The valve system includes a valve body, a first inlet passage for receiving soap solution, a second inlet passage for receiving water, and an outlet passage for providing a proportional mixture of the two fluids.
• The valve means is adjustable to permit the mixture to range from 0% soap solution, 100% water to 100% soap solution, 0% water.
• The valve system includes a flow restricting device to reduce the flow rate of soap solution entering the valve, and a spool valve with a cylindrical portion and a bore that is radially offset from the longitudinal axis of the valve.
• The valve system allows for continuous analog control of the proportional quantities of soap solution and water emerging from the outlet passage, and can operate multiple identical valve systems from a common soap solution source and common water source without affecting fluid pressure.
• The valve system is designed to maintain constant fluid pressures at the inlet passages, even when multiple valve systems are operating simultaneously, by reducing the flow rate of fluid through the valve as it is rotated away from axial alignment with its respective passages.

<summary>
* The invention relates to a method and arrangement for compressing gas in a compressor station for a gas pipeline, particularly in permanent frost areas, where the gas is compressed to a higher pressure, cooled, and then expanded to a lower pressure to achieve the desired exit temperature and pressure.
* The method involves compressing the gas to an excess pressure, cooling it by heat exchange, and then expanding it to the desired exit pressure, which allows for a temperature reduction to at least the desired exit temperature, eliminating the need for separate re-cooling units.
* The arrangement includes multiple compression stages, heat exchangers, and expansion turbines, which can be operated in different configurations depending on the season, allowing for efficient and flexible operation.
* The invention provides a cost-effective and safe solution for gas compression, with lower investment costs and reduced risk of accidents compared to conventional re-cooling technology, and can be used in various applications, including long-distance gas pipelines.

<summary>
* Electronic components produce heat, and in some applications, free convection cooling is not sufficient to prevent overheating, so electric fans are used to move ambient air across the components at a higher rate.
* Cooling fans are often integrated with an enclosure that houses the electronic components, and are typically mounted to the enclosure using fasteners such as screws, dowel pins, or rivets, which increases the cost of the product.
* The present invention discloses a system for eliminating fasteners traditionally used for securing cooling fans to an enclosure, which can be used in various applications including automotive, computer, electronic instrumentation, and others.
* The cooling fan assembly includes a motor, fan blade, and motor carrier, which is mounted to a panel using a plurality of mounting legs with resilient leg portions that are separated by a compression gap.
* The panel includes recess portions with openings that correspond to the mounting legs, and the motor carrier includes spring members that urge the motor carrier away from the panel once the mounting legs are in their fully seated position.
* The installation process involves bringing the cooling fan assembly into contact with the panel, applying a compressive force to compress the spring members, and rotating the assembly to move the mounting legs into the recess portions, where they are captured by the residual opening.
* The spring members remain in a compressed state, urging the motor carrier against the panel, which prevents vibrational noise and ensures that the mounting legs do not "back out" of their respective openings.

<summary>
* The invention relates to kinematic mounts used to support precision instruments in spacecraft, which require advanced lightweight and stiff composite materials to meet weight efficiency requirements, but lack inherent damping or vibration dissipation characteristics.
* The invention aims to provide kinematic mounts with novel damping features to protect instruments from potentially damaging flight loads, by incorporating passive energy dissipating mechanisms that can be applied to existing kinematic mount structures.
* The proposed design uses viscoelastic materials (VEM) to introduce damping into the six mount suspension modes, which can be achieved through various embodiments, including spherical dampers and cylindrical slot dampers, and can be tailored to provide specific damping characteristics.
* The invention enables the use of damped kinematic mounts to reduce vibration response and protect instruments from flight-induced loads, and can be applied to a wide range of precision or optical instruments/sensors where alignment stability is important.

<summary>
* The invention relates to a large size oil shear type clutch unit, particularly for use in an aircraft catapult system, which can transmit high horsepower while minimizing residual drag.
* The clutch unit features a novel arrangement of interleaved clutch plates and discs, with separate piston and cylinder means for each disc segment, allowing for simultaneous application of strong coupling forces and high control accuracy.
* The unit also includes an auxiliary fluid supply system that provides cooling to the clutch discs and positively retracts the clutch plates to minimize residual drag, using the centrifugal force of the oil to obviate the need for retraction springs.
* The clutch discs are segmented and can be easily removed and replaced without disassembling the entire unit, allowing for convenient inspection and maintenance.

<summary>
• The invention describes an internal combustion engine that uses a combination of combustion cylinders and expansion cylinders to capture and convert a large percentage of the heat energy generated by combustion into mechanical energy, reducing the need for a radiator and increasing thermal efficiency.
• The engine uses a water injection system to inject water into the expansion cylinders, which creates steam that expands and drives the pistons, allowing for the capture of additional heat energy and increasing the overall efficiency of the engine.
• The engine design also incorporates features such as catalytic materials, thermal insulation, and water recovery systems to minimize emissions, reduce heat loss, and conserve water, making it a more efficient and environmentally friendly alternative to traditional internal combustion engines.

<summary>
• The invention relates to the fabrication of plates or blanks of coated steel intended to be welded and then heat-treated to obtain parts with good mechanical characteristics and good corrosion resistance.
• The coated steel plate has a precoat consisting of an intermetallic alloy layer topped by a metal alloy layer, and an area at the periphery of the plate has the metal alloy layer removed, leaving only the intermetallic alloy layer.
• The removal of the metal alloy layer can be done by brushing or laser ablation, and the width of the removal area is adjusted to prevent the introduction of the metal coating into the molten metal during welding and to ensure corrosion resistance after heat treatment.
• The welded blank is then heated to form a surface intermetallic alloy compound that prevents oxidation and decarburization of the underlying steel, and is then hot-deformed to its final shape and cooled to confer the target mechanical characteristics.
• The invention provides a method for fabricating parts with good mechanical properties and corrosion resistance, and is particularly suitable for the production of structural or safety parts for motorized terrestrial vehicles.

<summary>
* The present invention relates to a remote control system for a mobile energy recovery structure that extracts energy from severe weather patterns, such as hurricanes or typhoons.
* The system includes a Supervisory Control and Data Acquisition (SCADA) system that remotely controls the operation and navigation of the mobile structure.
* The SCADA system uses weather data from various sources, including weather satellites, GPS, and weather buoys, to optimize the mobile structure's position and velocity for energy extraction.
* The system also uses sensors on the mobile structure to monitor its performance and adjust its operation accordingly.
* The SCADA system includes a control algorithm that uses the weather data and sensor data to determine the optimal path for the mobile structure to follow.
* The algorithm takes into account factors such as wind direction, wind speed, wave data, and the mobile structure's performance to determine the optimal path.
* The system also includes a human-machine interface that allows human operators to monitor and control the mobile structure remotely.
* The interface includes graphical displays that show the mobile structure's position, velocity, and performance, as well as weather data and other relevant information.
* The system can be used for various types of mobile energy recovery structures, including sailing vessels, propelled vessels, and energy-extracting turbines.

<summary>
* The invention relates to a rolling body guide cage produced from at least one ring element and several guide structures arranged in succession in the circumferential direction.
* The ring element is composed of at least two flat material ring segments joined to one another in succession in the circumferential direction and connected, in particular welded, to one another in a production step preceding the formation of the axial profiling.
* The invention reduces production costs by minimizing cutting waste in the manufacture of rolling body guide cages produced by forming techniques.
* The flat material ring segments are preferably cut out, in particular punched out, from a sheet metal material, and a relatively high material saving can be achieved by forming the flat material ring segments as 120° ring segments.
* Only three weld points are required for joining together a ring element from such flat material ring segments.
* The ring segments can be produced in such a manner that they initially have a slight oversize and are initially further cut and where necessary calibrated after welding in the context of a contouring step.
* The ring segments can be joined together in the context of the workpiece movement to be attributed to the punching process to form a ring segment.
* A particularly high-quality design of the weld connection points can be achieved by generating a material bead close to the edge during punching out of the ring segment or during punching out.
* The invention is suitable for the manufacture of radial bearing cages and axial bearing cages, in particular cages of groove and angular ball bearings.
* The rolling body guide cage can be structured such that it is composed of a first ring element and a structurally identical second ring element positioned in mirror-symmetry.

<summary>
* The invention relates to methods and systems for obtaining and processing information associated with customer service locations, including latitude and longitude coordinates, to facilitate efficient and effective customer service in the telecommunications industry.
* The system includes a technician input device, a technician server, a global positioning satellite system, a dispatch system, an address guide system, and a customer record system, which work together to provide accurate location information and routing directions for service technicians to travel between customer service locations.

<summary>
* The invention relates to a system for compensating electromagnetic interfering fields, particularly magnetic fields, using two sensors and a digital processor.
* The system aims to compensate both homogeneous and inhomogeneous magnetic fields.
* The system uses two real triaxial magnetic field sensors, three pairs of compensation coils, and a control unit to protect an object from interfering fields.
* The control unit combines the output signals of the two real sensors to create a virtual sensor signal, which is then used to generate control signals for the compensation coils.
* The virtual sensor signal is calculated by multiplying the output signals of the real sensors by a 6x6 matrix M, which describes the geometry of the arrangement and how the signals are combined.
* The control unit can use various control algorithms, including broadband, frequency-selective, and nonlinear algorithms, to process the virtual sensor signal.
* The system can be used to compensate gradient fields, and can also be used in situations where two compensation systems are operated directly beside each other.
* In the case of two compensation systems, a feedback matrix C is used to account for the cross-talk between the two systems.
* The system can be used to protect objects from interfering fields in various applications, including imaging systems using magnetic fields, such as scanning electron microscopes (SEM).
* The invention provides a flexible and adaptable system for compensating electromagnetic interfering fields, which can be optimized for different applications and configurations.

<summary>
* The invention relates to a method for investigating a sample derived from a biological source using Coherent Anti-Stokes Raman Scattering (CARS) microscopy, where a resonance signal is generated by exciting at least one resonance site of the sample using laser irradiation, and the method comprises furnishing at least one resonance site by means of a bioorthogonal reaction of an intrinsic chemical structure of the sample with at least one further reaction partner.
* The bioorthogonal reaction introduces a resonance site into the sample, allowing for selective detection of target sites in the sample without negatively affecting biochemical processes, and enabling the generation of a stable, reproducible background signal that can be correlated with the signal from the resonance site.

<summary>
* The invention is a system for assessing segmentations from various sources, such as clinicians or autosegmentation software, for radiation therapy treatment planning.
* The system compares two or more electronic segmentation files, which provide image-like data depicting a segmentation of a structure within a patient, to evaluate the quality of the segmentations.
* The system uses a stored program to receive the segmentation files, convert them to volume models, and compare the volume models to identify common, missing, and extra volume elements.
* The system provides a metric method to evaluate the conformance of the segmentations, which can be customized by the user.
* The metric method takes into account the distance between missing or extra volume elements and the closest common volume element.
* The system provides a graphical interface to display the segmentations and the results of the comparison, including a shaded display of common, missing, and extra volume elements.
* The system can be used for training clinicians, quality assurance testing of autosegmentation routines, and assessing autosegmentation routines against updated imaging technology.
* The system can also be used to assess whether a new treatment plan should be prepared based on changes in the internal anatomy of the patient during radiation therapy.
* The system is flexible and can be modified to accommodate different segmentation files, metric methods, and display formats.

<summary>
* The invention relates to data processing systems and specifically to the apparatus for executing floating point operations.
* The floating point format has the disadvantage of requiring more time to execute addition and subtraction operations compared to standard data formats.
* The invention aims to accelerate the effective subtraction operation in a floating point unit by using a difference between a subset of signals of the operand exponent arguments.
* The subset difference is used to begin the subtraction of differences between operand fractions prior to the availability of the complete difference between the exponent arguments.
* The procedures are chosen such that when the complete operand argument difference is different from the subset operand argument difference, the correct result fraction is one of the operand fractions, which is available.
* The invention accelerates the effective subtraction operation by dividing it into two procedures based on the absolute value of the difference in the arguments of the exponents of the two operands.
* The apparatus implementing the invention includes a detection logic unit, shift and selection logic unit, subtraction unit, and selection logic unit to perform the accelerated effective subtraction operation.

<summary>
• The invention relates to the collection of blood and medical specimens, particularly in a hospital setting, and aims to reduce or eliminate mislabeling of specimen vials.
• The method involves storing patient information, order information, and specimen vial information in a relational manner in a computer database.
• A unique barcode is assigned to each patient, order, blood drawer, and specimen vial, and these barcodes are used to track the specimen collection process.
• The method involves inputting the barcodes into a computer, which verifies that the patient and order information match, and then stores the information in a relational manner.
• The computer generates a signal to draw the blood sample and sends it to the lab for analysis, and the blood drawer inputs an indication of completion into the computer.
• The system provides a complete record of the blood drawing event, including the patient information, order information, blood drawer information, and specimen vial information.
• The invention aims to achieve a failsafe, zero-defect process for identifying and processing patient specimen samples, eliminating the need for vial labels and associated costs.

<summary>
• The invention is a voice-activated distance measuring device that provides golfers with distance and other information on a golf course using GPS technology and voice recognition.
