• The device can be incorporated into an article of clothing, such as a hat or visor, and uses a bone conductance vibration sensor to detect voice commands.
• The device can provide verbal information on distance, pin placement, green size, and other golf course parameters, and can also accept verbal input to memorize and compute golf strategy, club selection, and rules.
• The device can be connected to a personal computer or similar technology to upload and download data, including course databases, and to facilitate graphical display of scores and ball trajectories.
• The device can also be used for other applications, such as hiking, surveying, and hunting, and can be designed for underwater use with scuba divers.
• The device uses Bluetooth technology for data transfers, audio output, and short-range audio communications, and can be used as a remote GPS or audio client for other devices.

<summary>
* The invention relates to a design rule checking system and method for integrated circuits (ICs) that combines logic and memory circuits, ensuring accurate error detection and elimination of false errors.
* The system uses customized design rules for different types of memory regions, created by modifying standard logic rules to accommodate more liberal parameters for memory areas.
* The method applies the right set of rules to the right regions of the mask pattern data, avoiding false errors and ensuring accurate design rule checks.
* The system can be used for various types of memory, including SRAM, DRAM, and ROM, and can be extended to other design rules for other areas with differing requirements.
* The invention eliminates the need for manual checking and reduces the possibility of false errors, making the design development cycle more efficient.
* The system can be implemented using conventional computer systems and software routines, and can be applied to various industries, including liquid crystal display manufacturing and similar micro-patterned technologies.
* The invention provides a more reliable and efficient way to check design rules for ICs with mixed circuit types, ensuring accurate implementation of circuit designs into silicon form.

<summary>
• The invention uses thin substrate waveguides as illuminators for objects with specific illumination requirements, such as display holograms or spatial light modulators.
• The waveguide hologram illuminator provides high diffraction efficiency and can be used to pattern light to hit only preselected areas, increasing illuminator efficiency.
• The illuminator occupies much less space compared to conventional lens illumination systems and can be optically contacted to the object being illuminated, reducing reflection losses.
• The diffraction efficiency of the waveguide hologram illuminator can approach 0.99, and the absence of stray light propagating forward to the observer is ideal for minimizing noise and discomfort.
• However, the illuminator has some penalties, including critical alignment of the laser beam, time delay across the hologram, and nonuniformity of the diffracted wavefront along the propagation direction.
• The nonuniformity can be compensated for by recording the hologram nonuniformly or by exposing a photographic emulsion to the uncompensated beam, and the two-sidedness of the diffracted beam can be addressed by absorbing or reflecting the light emerging from one side.

<summary>
* The invention relates to a method and apparatus for testing dynamoelectric machine rotors, particularly squirrel cage rotors, to detect defects and determine their electrical properties such as resistance, reactance, and effective skew.
* The apparatus includes a test head with a core of magnetic material, primary windings, voltage and skew sensing pick-up coils, and a current sensor, which are used to measure the rotor's electrical properties when it is rotated within the test head.
* The test data is acquired and processed by a data acquisition and processing system, which includes a sample and hold circuit, an analog to digital converter, and a data processor, to calculate the rotor's resistance, reactance, effective skew, dissymmetry, and skew dissymmetry.
* The apparatus also includes a retraction and drive mechanism to rotate the rotor during testing, and a control system to control the test sequence, display the results, and store statistical data for further analysis.

<summary>
* The document describes a method for securing a mobile device by controlling access to native resources and operating system methods, allowing third-party applications to run while preventing malicious code from accessing sensitive areas.
* A managed library is granted access to native resources of an operating system in response to validating a digital certificate associated with the managed library, ensuring that only trusted code can access sensitive areas.
* A managed application is denied access to native resources of the operating system if it includes a digital certificate authorizing access to specific native resources through a managed library, preventing untrusted code from accessing sensitive areas.
* The ecosystem provider can associate a certificate with a managed application that identifies it as un-trusted and lists the managed libraries it can call, allowing the manager to prevent the application from accessing native system resources or terminate it if it attempts to access unauthorized resources.
* The native functions of the operating system are accessed through instructions for a runtime host, which are effectuated by native instructions, providing an additional layer of security and control over access to sensitive areas.

<summary>
* The invention relates to an improved identification card containing an internal antenna and integrated circuit chip laminated between two protective, non-rigid layers onto which artwork may be printed, which are then laminated between two rigid outer layers.
* The card is designed to protect the electronic components from damage, with the rigid outer layers disseminating external forces over a broad area of compliant layers, and the use of a silica-filled polyolefin core layer and bottom layer that can absorb shocks and stresses.
* The card can be personalized using various printing methods, including dye diffusion thermal transfer and inkjet printing, and can include additional security features such as low cohesivity layers, security inks, and optically variable inks to prevent tampering or counterfeiting.

<summary>
* The invention relates to the implementation of a memory, specifically a queue, in a functional memory environment where updates are made by copying and updating a tree-shaped data structure.
* The queue is implemented as a tree-shaped data structure with nodes having a maximum size, where additions and deletions are made to the tree in a specific manner to maintain balance and fill conditions.
* The tree-shaped data structure is used to implement a FIFO (First-In-First-Out) queue, where additions are made to the first non-full node from the bottom of the tree and deletions are made from the leaf nodes.
* The invention reduces the amount of copying required for updates, making it more efficient than traditional queue implementations.
* The tree-shaped data structure can be used to implement a double-ended queue (deque) by adding a bit to indicate the direction of the queue.
* The queue can be inverted in constant time and space by changing the value of the inversion bit.
* A header node can be added to the tree-shaped data structure to improve performance and reduce space requirements.
* The header node contains three elements: one pointing to the end of the queue, one pointing to the middle of the queue, and one pointing to the beginning of the queue.
* The invention can be used in a memory arrangement with an actual memory, intermediate registers, and control logic to maintain the queue.
* The invention is not limited to a fixed maximum size of nodes, but can be modified to have level-specific maximum sizes or other variations.

<summary>
* The invention relates to electrically programmable read-only memory (EPROM) devices that can be manufactured using existing integrated circuit (IC) technologies, allowing for the integration of EPROM devices with other types of ICs, such as DRAM or logic circuits, on the same wafer without additional manufacturing cost.
* The invention also describes a novel type of EPROM device called "stress effect programmable read-only memory" (SEPROM) that uses the damages caused by electrical stresses on common transistors to store data, which can be manufactured by any IC technology and is ideal for embedded applications.

<summary>
• The invention relates to a method of determining feedback gain in a feedback control system, particularly for an automatic guidance vehicle (AGV).
• The method involves provisionally determining a feedback gain, executing feedback control using the gain, detecting an error, calculating an evaluation value, and repeating the process with a new gain value to determine the optimal gain.
• The evaluation value is calculated based on the error, and the optimal gain is determined when the evaluation value reaches a minimum or ideal value.
• The method is applicable to determining the optimal values of proportional (P), integral (I), and differential (D) gains in a PID control system.
• The invention provides a simple and efficient way to determine the optimal feedback gains, without the need for complex multiple variable analysis.
• The method can be used in various applications, including AGV control, and can be adapted to different types of feedback gains.
• The invention improves the stability, accuracy, and response of the feedback control system by determining the optimal feedback gains.

<summary>
• The invention relates to a zoom lens with a high relative aperture, high zoom ratio, and standard image angle at the wide angle end, while minimizing the physical size of the entire lens system.
• The lens consists of five units: a first unit for focusing, a second unit for varying magnification, a third unit for compensating for image plane shift, a fourth unit for making the light beam almost parallel, and a fifth unit for image formation.
• The invention achieves high grade optical performance throughout the entire zooming range by satisfying specific conditions related to the refractive power of the fourth and fifth lens units, and the Abbe numbers of the media of the first and sixth lenses in the fifth unit.
• The total length of the lens system is reduced to as short as L=9.13φA to 9.19φA, making it suitable for use in photographic cameras or video cameras.

<summary>
* The invention relates to a method and device for detecting elementary particles, such as protons, ions, electrons, neutrons, and photons, in a detector.
* The method involves generating a charge pulse in the detector when a particle passes through, converting the pulse into an electric signal, and amplifying the signal in a first, fast amplifier and/or a second, slow amplifier.
* The device includes a detector, a first amplifier for amplifying individual signals, and a second amplifier for integrating signals, with the option to switch between the two amplifiers based on the signal rate.
* The invention allows for both the detection of individual particles and the integration of signals at high rates or frequencies, without knowing in advance the signal rates to be expected.
* The device can be used in various applications, including particle accelerators, reactor installations, and medical technology, such as X-ray devices and CT scanners.
* The invention provides a low-voltage-side wiring of the measuring electronics, which prevents the influence of leakage currents in high-voltage cables and enables the precise measurement of the detector current.
* The detector material can be doped or coated with a converter material to detect uncharged particles, and materials enabling fast charge transport at room temperature, such as diamond, can be used as the detector material.
* The invention enables the detection of packets of particles, which can be summed up to enable a statement about the overall particle rate, and can be used for measuring intensity in particle accelerators and detecting the actual formation of a particle beam.

<summary>
• The invention relates to an apparatus for automatically spin checking driven disc assemblies used in friction clutches, which determines whether the assembly is within specified tolerances and generates an external indication to the operator.
• The apparatus includes a test enclosure with a stationary ring and a movable ring, a torque motor, and a position sensor to measure the distance between the rings.
• A driven disc assembly is installed on a splined hub within the test enclosure, and the movable ring is moved towards the stationary ring to frictionally engage the assembly.
• The torque motor is then energized to exert a predetermined torque on the assembly, and the movable ring is gradually moved away from the stationary ring to reduce the frictional force.
• The position sensor measures the distance between the rings when the assembly begins to rotate, and this distance is compared to a standard value to determine if the assembly is within tolerances.
• If the assembly is within tolerances, the apparatus indicates this to the operator and allows the assembly to be removed and replaced with another for testing.
• If the assembly is not within tolerances, the apparatus indicates this to the operator and requires manual acknowledgement before allowing the assembly to be removed.
• The apparatus can store measurements for statistical process control and minimizes the chances of operator error.
• The invention provides an improved spin checking apparatus that operates automatically without manual involvement and generates an external indication to the operator of whether the driven disc assembly is good or bad.

<summary>
• The invention relates to a method and system for estimating the age of a person from a facial image, using a contourlet appearance model (CAM) to extract features from the image.
• The CAM is a statistical model that combines shape and texture information to represent the face, and is robust against noise and variations in lighting.
• The method involves training a CAM on a database of facial images with known ages, and using the trained model to extract features from a new image.
• The features are then used to estimate the age of the person in the new image, using a support vector regression (SVR) algorithm.
• The SVR algorithm is trained on the features extracted from the training images, and learns to predict the age of a person based on the features.
• The method can be used to estimate the age of a person in a single image, or to track the age of a person over time from a sequence of images.
• The system can be used in various applications, such as security, healthcare, and marketing.
• The invention can also be used to estimate other demographic information, such as gender, ethnicity, and facial expression.
• The system can be implemented on a computer or mobile device, and can be used in real-time or offline mode.

<summary>
• The invention relates to a matrix display device for displaying two merged images, where one image has a higher definition than the other, and the device preserves the definition of the higher-definition image.
• The device uses a mosaic of identical arrangements of pixels, where each arrangement has a first number of pixels dedicated to the first image and the remaining pixels dedicated to the second image.
• The light intensity signals for the first image are applied to the corresponding pixels, and the light intensity signals for the second image are applied to the remaining pixels, or a combination of the signals is used to display the merged image.
• The device can be configured to display a first image with a high definition and a second image with a lower definition, such as a monochrome image with a graphical overlay.
• The invention proposes various embodiments, including one where the second image is displayed on a quarter of the definition of the matrix of the display device, and another where the second image is displayed on a submatrix of the display device.
• The device can be implemented with a dedicated hardware architecture, including two controllers, one for each image, which can be integrated into the matrix or external to it, and can offer advantages in terms of lower power consumption.

<summary>
• The invention relates to a mobile identification transmitter for keyless activation of a security system in a motor vehicle, which has a housing with electronics and a communication means, and a payment element removably fastened in a receptacle of the housing.
• The payment element can be removed from the housing by the user, and the receptacle is sealed by a closure when the payment element is removed, to prevent unauthorized use and protect the electronics from environmental factors.
• The payment element can be used for cashless payment transactions, and can have a credit card function and/or debit card function, and can communicate with a payment system via a communication means.
• The identification transmitter has a normal state and a secure state, in which the payment element is removed and the receptacle is sealed, but communication with the security system of the motor vehicle is still possible.
• The invention provides a convenient and secure way for users to make payments and access their vehicles, while protecting their payment information and preventing unauthorized use.

<summary>
• The document describes an imaging device, such as a xerographic machine, that becomes inactive when not in use and enters a "sleep mode" to save energy.
• When the device "wakes up" from sleep mode, the toner's tribo-electro-static charge (tribo charge) may decrease, affecting image quality.
• The disclosed embodiments address this issue by charging the toner to a predetermined level based on the period of inactivity.
• The toner charge level is measured using a toner concentration (TC) sensor, which detects the tribo charge of the toner.
• The TC sensor output is used to adjust the supply of toner to maintain a consistent image quality.
• The device includes an inactivity determining section, a predicting section, a measuring section, a calculating section, an updating section, a storing section, a charging section, and a performing section.
• The inactivity determining section determines the period of inactivity, and the predicting section predicts the next user usage based on the user's usage pattern.
• The measuring section measures the TC sensor level, and the calculating section calculates the decay of the tribo charge based on the measured levels.
• The charging section charges the toner to a predetermined level based on the calculated decay, and the performing section performs a printing operation after the developer is charged.

<summary>
• The invention relates to a rotary magnetic head type apparatus that can control the recording and reproduction of signals with high precision using plural magneto resistive heads (MR heads) mounted on a rotary drum, and more particularly to a recording/reproducing apparatus that can independently regulate bias currents supplied to plural MR heads.
• The apparatus includes a control signal generator, a decoder, and a current supply circuit, which work together to control the bias currents supplied to the MR heads, and a regenerative amplifier that amplifies the signals reproduced by the MR heads, and can switch over the output signals of the MR heads at every 180° turn of the rotary drum.
• The invention also relates to a recording/reproducing apparatus that can record and reproduce data at high speed using a double azimuth (DA) structure, in which two pairs of recording heads and MR heads are arranged at 90° intervals, and the recording heads and MR heads are mounted opposite to each other at 180°, and can independently regulate the bias currents supplied to the MR heads and the recording currents supplied to the recording heads.

<summary>
* The invention relates to locating and tracing concealed elongated conductive objects, such as pipes or cables, and improves the ease and accuracy of locating and tracing one object in the presence of an adjacent object.
* Prior art methods use a transmitter to induce alternating currents in non-ferrous metal pipes or cables, and a receiver to sense magnetic fields associated with the currents, but are limited when multiple objects are present.
* The invention uses a transmitter with two antennae to induce distinguishable alternating currents in two adjacent objects, and a receiver that senses both fields and produces an output signal dependent on both fields.
* The transmitter is optimally positioned relative to the objects, and the receiver is moved back and forth across the objects to produce an output signal characteristic with distinct nulls over each object.
* The invention uses techniques such as different carrier frequencies, amplitude modulation, or pulse rates to make the currents distinguishable, and produces a beat frequency signal when both currents are present.
* The invention is particularly useful when the horizontal separation between the objects is related to their depth, and the field from the transmitter decreases with distance, reducing interference between the objects.

<summary>
• The invention relates to an apparatus for interfacing a speaker phone with a telephone network to permit hands-free automatic answering and communication.
• The apparatus includes a source of power, selective switch means, a coupler, a timer, and a bypass switch, which work together to automatically answer incoming calls and connect them to a speaker phone.
• The invention provides two embodiments: an electronic embodiment using an optocoupler and a timer circuit, and an electromechanical embodiment using a neon lamp and a photocell relay.
• The apparatus allows for hands-free communication, automatic answering of incoming calls, and timed termination of calls, with the option to extend the call duration indefinitely.
• The invention is designed to be modular, portable, and easy to install, making it suitable for use in various settings, such as homes, offices, and hospitals.

<summary>
* The invention relates to a system for reducing or eliminating undersea optical repeaters in a trunk and branch ring network by replacing repeaters with remotely pumped optical amplifiers and remotely supplying energy to those optical amplifiers over the same branch cables that also distribute communications signals.
* The system uses a trunk and branch structure with a ring geometry, which provides strong survivability features, including maintaining connectivity in the event of a single trunk cut and isolating only the affected branch in the event of a branch cut.
* The system utilizes the branch fiber optic cable to transmit optical energy at a wavelength other than the signal wavelength, which is used to power an optical amplifier, providing signal amplification without the use of conventional optical repeaters.
* The system includes a hub assembly with remote pumping, which couples a light emitting power source onto the optical fiber cable trunk, and an optical amplifier that amplifies the signal using the energy from the power source.
* The system also includes branch assemblies, each consisting of a cable station, a light emitting power source, and a branching unit, which allows for convenient add/drop points for telecommunications traffic from the cable trunk.
* The branch fiber optic cable transmits bidirectional optical communications signals between the cable station and the optical fiber cable trunk, and also transmits unidirectional energy from the light emitting power source to the optical amplifier.
* The system provides numerous advantages, including reduced capital and operating costs, increased network reliability, and flexibility in network design and configuration.

<summary>
* The invention is a cover plate device for wall-mounted electrical wiring devices that eliminates the need for visible fasteners, providing a finished look and preventing shock hazards. The device consists of a two-part system, with an attachment plate that is installed over the wiring device and a cover plate that is attached to the attachment plate without visible screws.
* The cover plate device can be easily installed and removed using simple tools, and its design allows it to accommodate variations in wall flatness and evenness, making it suitable for use with multiple wiring devices and ganged boxes of different sizes.

<summary>
* The invention relates to a collapsible light-shielding device for a screen, consisting of concentrically nested annular strips that can be extended or folded in to block out light and reflections, allowing for clear viewing of the screen from various angles.
* The device is designed to be compact, easy to use, and adaptable to different screen types, with features such as hook and locking elements, a flat attachment face, and a decreasing wall thickness in the axial direction to enable smooth extension and retraction.

<summary>
* The invention relates to automated speech technologies, specifically a system that alerts a speaker when their rate of speech is likely to be too fast for a listener to comprehend.
* The system determines the speaker's speaking rate and compares it to a speaking rate threshold based on the listener's language proficiency, and alerts the speaker to slow down if necessary.
* The system can also consider factors such as speech clarity, emotional content, and network quality (in the case of voice network connections) when determining the speaking rate threshold.
* The system can be implemented in various forms, including wearable devices, teleprompters, and networked computing devices, and can provide alerts to the speaker through various means such as vibration, beeps, or displayed messages.
* The system can also suggest alternative languages for the discourse if the speaker and listener share a common language other than the one being spoken.

<summary>
* The invention relates to a device for optical recording of rapid processes using a TV camera, which allows for high-speed recording with a high and selectable resolution in time.
* The device uses a cyclic line counter, a sawtooth generator, and a beam suppression circuit to control the scanning beam, allowing for the recording of N lines of a picture plane in a cyclic and successive manner.
* The device can be programmed to record a variable number of lines per picture, allowing for adjustable time resolution and spatial resolution, and can be used for recording processes that require high-speed analysis, such as IR, UV, or X-ray pictures.
* The recorded video signals can be digitized and stored for analysis, and the device is suitable for use in laboratory and industrial processes, offering a cost-effective alternative to high-speed cameras with rotating mirrors.

<summary>
• The invention relates to multimedia communications, particularly handling multimedia calls with clients having legacy phones and services, allowing integration of voice and multimedia capabilities without replacing existing network equipment.
• The invention provides a solution for integrating voice calls with multimedia sessions as a blended call, using a multimedia server with blender software that manages blended calls and controls signaling paths.
• The blender software receives a call request, initiates two call components (voice and multimedia), and passes the voice component to a telephony server and the multimedia component to a multimedia server.
• The invention supports both incoming and outgoing calls, and allows clients to make voice calls and send instant messages, with the ability to activate multimedia features mid-call.
• The invention uses Session Initiation Protocol (SIP) and SIP-T to facilitate communication between devices and servers, and can be integrated with an Intelligent Network (IN) for basic call disposition handling.
• The blender software prevents infinite loops between the telephony server and the blender by including indicia or a loopback signal in the call request.
• The invention allows for backwards compatibility with existing network devices and protocols, and can be used with various networks and protocols, including packet switched networks and SIP enabled devices.

<summary>
• The present invention relates to a content synchronization framework that allows connected devices to perform contextual synchronization over various network topologies, using transport optimization and compression to save bandwidth and time.
• The framework comprises a central reference point, client devices, and external partners, and enables synchronization of content based on dynamic attributes sent by the client device, which are combined with additional attributes collected from external partners to compile bundle information.
• The client device creates a delta list of files to retrieve based on the response from the central reference point, and downloads the files in the order of priority, with incomplete bundles being rejected, and the process resuming from where it left off in case of a connection failure.
• The framework is highly scalable, supports multiple languages and character sets, and allows for caching of responses to decrease response times, and is deployable worldwide with support for synchronous and asynchronous interaction between the central reference point and connected devices.

<summary>
* The invention relates to a system and method for facilitating communication between a finder of a lost object and its owner, while maintaining the privacy of both parties.
* The system uses a unique ID and a virtual locale (e.g. a website) to facilitate communication, and allows the owner to register their contact information and associate it with the ID.
* The finder can access the virtual locale and enter the ID to initiate communication with the owner, and the system generates anonymous email addresses to facilitate communication between the two parties.
* The system allows the owner to manage their contact information and view open cases, and the finder can view open cases and communicate with the owner through the system.
* The system also allows for the exchange of anonymous messages between the finder and owner, and can forward emails to the owner's real email address while keeping the finder's email address anonymous.
* The system periodically checks for incoming emails and forwards them to the appropriate party, while maintaining the anonymity of the parties involved.

<summary>
• The invention relates to electron multipliers, specifically a foil electron multiplier that uses a series of thin foils to multiply electrons in a transmission stage.
• The foil electron multiplier has a higher gain per stage than conventional electron multipliers, making it more efficient.
• The invention uses a series of thin foils, each with a front side for receiving incident particles and a back side for transmitting secondary electrons.
• The foils are arranged collinearly in an evacuated enclosure and are biased with a voltage to accelerate secondary electrons.
• The gain of the foil electron multiplier is maximized by optimizing the voltage per stage, transmission through the support grid, and secondary electron emission yield.
• The foil electron multiplier can be used in photomultiplier tubes and particle detectors, such as channel electron multipliers and microchannel plates.
• The invention has several advantages over conventional electron multipliers, including higher gain per stage, simplicity of fabrication, lower cost, and ability to cover larger areas.
• The foil electron multiplier can provide position-sensitive information on where an incident particle impacted the first stage of the multiplier.
• The invention does not experience ion feedback, which is a limitation of conventional electron multipliers.
• The foil electron multiplier has been demonstrated using carbon foils with a thickness of 0.6 μg/cm2 and has shown a higher gain efficiency than conventional electron multipliers.
</summary>

<summary>
• The 3-D Phenomenoscope is a system that allows viewers to watch 2D motion pictures with a 3D effect using the Pulfrich illusion, which creates depth perception from lateral motion.
• The system uses special glasses with individually controllable lenses that can be darkened or cleared in real-time based on the motion picture's content.
• The glasses have a digital sensor that captures the video image and a computer processor that analyzes the image and controls the lens states.
• The system can be used with any type of display device, including TVs, DVD players, PCs, and movie projectors.
• The 3-D Phenomenoscope does not require special filming or production techniques, and can be used with existing motion pictures.
• The system reduces eyestrain and discomfort by only activating the 3D effect when sustained lateral motion is detected.
• The glasses are battery-powered and do not require any external control signals.
• The system can be extended to other visual effects and algorithms that detect different types of motion.
• The 3-D Phenomenoscope overcomes the limitations of previous 3D systems, such as shutter glasses, and provides a more comfortable and convenient viewing experience.

<summary>
* The invention relates to a method and apparatus for dicing semiconductor wafers using pressure to mechanically separate individual die from the wafer without the use of a wafer saw.
* The method involves forming trenches along the scribe lines on the wafer, applying a mechanical pressure to the wafer, and causing a "clean break" of the wafer along the scribe lines to singulate individual die.
* The apparatus includes a pad for supporting the wafer, a positioning member to position the wafer on the pad, and a pressure mechanism to apply mechanical pressure to the wafer to singulate the individual die.

<summary>
* The invention relates to a field emission display (FED) device with a protection structure that prevents burnout damage to field emission elements caused by electrical current surges induced by ionized gases in the device.
* The protection structure includes one or multiple reduction plates or electrodes provided on the cathode, which are electrically connected to a bias voltage source to alter the discharge path of ionized gases away from the cathode.
* The reduction plates or electrodes can be arranged in various configurations, such as parallel and adjacent to rows of field emission elements, or in a meshwork- or net-shaped pattern among the field emission elements.
* The protection structure prevents surges in electrical current from being drawn to the cathode, thereby prolonging the lifetime of the device.
* The FED device with the protection structure can be fabricated using conventional deposition and etching techniques, and can be used in various applications such as flat panel displays.
* The invention provides a novel solution to the problem of burnout damage in FED devices, and offers improved reliability and performance in field emission display technology.

<summary>
* The present invention relates to an image sensor with multiple imaging planes, allowing it to image in a plurality of planes simultaneously.
* Typical CCD image sensors are formed on flat, circular semiconductor substrates and can only image on one surface.
* The invention overcomes the limitations of prior art by providing an image sensor that can record information through an edge surface of the sensor.
* The image sensor comprises a semiconductor substrate with opposed major surfaces and edges, an image sensor element formed in the substrate, and means for guiding charge carriers towards the image sensor element.
* The image sensor element includes a charge collection and transfer means and an image sensing region, and is formed in a P-type substrate with a highly doped bottom layer and a more lightly doped upper layer.
* The image sensor can have multiple columns of image sensor elements, each adapted to function with a different imaging plane, including imaging planes on the top surface and edge surfaces.
* The invention uses doped layers to create a waveguide-like structure adjacent to the edges of the sensor, guiding charge carriers towards the image sensor elements.
* The image sensor can be used in various applications, including simultaneous imaging of multiple planes, color applications, and document scanning.
* The invention can be formed using processing techniques compatible with those used in forming other types of image sensors, making it easily incorporable into various image sensor designs.

<summary>
* The invention relates to home networks and power management systems, particularly in reducing energy consumption when devices are not performing their nominal functions.
* The current problem is that network master nodes consume power even when not performing their nominal functions, and it is difficult for them to enter power save mode while still performing network administrative functions.
* The invention proposes a method for transferring network administrative functions from a master device to a slave device, allowing the master device to enter power save mode.
* The transfer of network administrative functions is done by sending data from the master device to the slave device, enabling the slave device to perform the functions.
* The slave device is selected based on predetermined criteria, such as visibility on the network, intelligence, or functional capabilities.
* The invention allows for the minimization of total power consumption of the home network while ensuring that the network administrative functions are performed by another device.
* The invention also enables a network slave node to self-promote itself to the network master node role if the current master node is unavailable.

<summary>
• The invention relates to an antenna array for measuring the direction of propagation of electromagnetic radiation, particularly at low elevation angles, using radio interferometric techniques. The array consists of at least four antennae spaced to provide at least two equi-spaced linear triplets perpendicular to a ground plane, with each triplet having a specific spacing and height above the ground plane.
• The array operates by combining vectorially the information signals obtained from the outermost antennae of each triplet to provide a first derived signal, and deriving a second derived signal from the centre antenna of each triplet. The quotient of these two signals is a function of the elevation angle but not of the ground reflection coefficient, allowing for unambiguous angle measurement.
• The invention has applications in various fields, including monitoring the height of aircraft approaching to land, and can be used in receive or transmit mode, with the ability to provide angle measurements with high accuracy and resolution over a wide range of elevation angles.

<summary>
* The invention relates to a seal supported subminiature lamp assembly that provides a liquid-tight seal, high heat resistance, and chemical resistance, making it suitable for medical and other applications where reliability and durability are critical.
* The assembly features a polymeric seal support that surrounds the glass envelope and abbreviated height one-piece conductive base, providing a longer seal length and eliminating the need for adhesives or cements, and can be used in various applications where insulation, high heat degradation resistance, and solvent and chemical resistance are required.

<summary>
• The document describes a technique for configuring a Generalized Decision Feedback Equalizer (GDFE) precoder in a multi-user multiple-input multiple-output (MU-MIMO) wireless system, which reduces computational cost while maintaining system capacity.
• The GDFE precoder is used to optimize system capacity in MU-MIMO systems, but its conventional design requires knowledge of the covariance matrix of the "Least Favorable Noise", which is computationally expensive to obtain.
• The proposed method avoids the need for this knowledge by using alternative formulas to compute the GDFE precoder matrices, including the filter matrix C, transmit filter matrix B, and feedforward filter matrix F.
• The method involves computing the filter matrix C using one of several alternative formulas, and then using C to compute B and F, which are used in the GDFE precoder.
• The alternative formulas for C are based on the channel matrix H, the input covariance matrix Sxx, and the "Least Favorable Noise" covariance matrix Szz, and can be used for channels with different ranks.
• The method is illustrated with a numerical example, which shows how to compute the GDFE precoder matrices using the proposed technique.

<summary>
• The invention relates to a heat-dissipating device and its housing, which aims to increase the intake airflow rate without modifying the assembling conditions with other elements.
• A conventional fan has a rectangular fan housing with a limited air passage, which restricts the design of the blade and wastes space and material.
• The invention provides a heat-dissipating fan with a housing that extends outwardly to enlarge the intake airflow area, allowing for a larger impeller and increased airflow rate.
• The housing has a passage with a sidewall that extends radially outwardly, which can be symmetrical or asymmetrical, and may have an inclined portion or beveled edge.
• The outward extension of the sidewall can be in a circular, elliptical, or frustum-conical shape, and may have notches to enlarge the intake airflow area.
• The heat-dissipating device can be used with a heat sink, which can be mounted to the device by screws, and can be used to cool electrical elements such as a CPU.
• The device can be mounted to a system casing and disposed near heat sources to enhance heat-dissipating efficiency and prevent electrical elements from being damaged by high temperatures.
• The passage formed by the sidewall of the housing has a gradually reduced inner diameter, which allows air streams to be concentrated to the central portion and flow directly towards the heat sink.
• The invention provides several advantages, including increased airflow rate, enhanced heat-dissipating efficiency, and reduced noise.
• The invention is not limited to the disclosed embodiments and can be modified to encompass various designs and applications.

<summary>
* The invention relates to an electroluminescent display panel that can display images in different colors according to the situation, without using an intermediate electrode. The panel has a simple structure and can be made at a low cost.
* The panel has a first luminescent layer that emits light without a red component, and a second luminescent layer that emits light with a red component. By changing the driving voltage, the panel can display images in different colors, such as green, lemon, and yellow, making it suitable for use in instrument panels for automobiles.

<summary>
• The invention relates to a portable communications terminal, system, and method for Internet/network telephony, which uses a network and/or the Internet for transferring information/data representing digitized speech, sounds, music, etc. The terminal has audio means, converting means, protocol means, and wireless communication means, and can establish a wireless connection to a connecting unit that establishes a connection to a network and/or the Internet.
• The system includes a service server that keeps track of which terminals/users are accessible and where, and can provide additional services such as news, reading of mails, speech mails, commercials, music, stock exchange and financial news, chat-lines, chat-rooms, telephone meetings, etc. The server can also establish a connection between users who want to communicate with each other.</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to the integration of high-dielectric oxide materials with semiconductor substrates, particularly silicon and gallium arsenide.
* The integration is challenging due to the reactivity of silicon with oxygen, leading to the formation of a low-dielectric constant layer.
* High-dielectric oxide materials, such as ferroelectrics, have desirable properties for applications like capacitors, MOS transistors, and electrooptic devices.
* Pb/Bi-containing high-dielectric materials are convenient due to their low annealing temperatures, but they are reactive and diffuse into metals.
* A Ge buffer layer can be used to prevent the formation of a low-dielectric constant layer and enable epitaxial growth of high-dielectric oxide materials.
* The Ge buffer layer is compatible with Si process technology and can be epitaxially grown on Si substrates.
* Not all oxides are stable next to Ge, and a thin layer of SrTiO3 or other stable ferroelectric can be used as a buffer layer between the Pb-containing ferroelectric and the Ge-coated Si substrate.
* The invention provides a method for fabricating a structure useful in semiconductor circuitry, comprising growing a buffer layer of non-Pb/Bi-containing high-dielectric constant oxide layer directly or indirectly on a semiconductor substrate, and depositing a Pb/Bi-containing high-dielectric constant oxide on the buffer layer.
* The invention also provides a structure useful in semiconductor circuitry, comprising a buffer layer of non-Pb/Bi-containing high-dielectric constant oxide layer directly or indirectly on a semiconductor substrate, and a Pb/Bi-containing high-dielectric constant oxide on the buffer layer.
* The use of a Ge buffer layer and a non-Pb/Bi-containing high-dielectric oxide buffer layer enables the integration of high-dielectric oxide materials with semiconductor substrates, allowing for the fabrication of devices with improved properties.

<summary>
* The invention relates to a receiver input circuit that enables substantial elimination of undesired signal actuation of non-linear components in the signal path, resulting in distortions, while taking into account adequate small signal behavior and using conventional components. The circuit uses multiple amplification control loops with different response thresholds and frequency bandwidths to control the amplification of the input signal.
* The circuit includes a preamplifier stage, a tunable selective network, a mixer and oscillator stage, and an intermediate frequency selective filter, with multiple control loops that control the amplification of the input signal to prevent overloading of the mixer stage and varactor diodes, and to reduce distortions and interference effects.

<summary>
• The invention relates to a system and method for setting up a collaborative work-sharing environment between physically distant individuals using network-enabled applications.
• The system allows users to initiate a collaborative session with a single button click, without requiring complex setup processes or technical expertise.
• The system uses a telephone with a collaborate indicator and button, which signals to the user that the party has the capability of collaborating with them.
• When the collaborate button is pressed, the system launches a collaboration application program on the user's desktop PC, allowing for shared information, video conferencing, and other collaborative activities.
• The system uses a call control unit to manage the call setup and collaboration process, and can be implemented over a local area network (LAN), wide area network (WAN), or the Internet.
• The invention can be applied to various types of collaboration applications, including video conferencing, document sharing, and virtual whiteboarding.
• The system can be implemented in a peer-to-peer architecture or using a client-server architecture, and can support multiparty collaboration with minor modifications.
• The invention can be implemented using a computer program operating on a computer, and can be carried on a storage medium such as a floppy disk, CD ROM, or magnetic tape, or transmitted over a network such as the Internet.

<summary>
* The invention relates to a method and device for inserting advertising clips into a video sequence, taking into account the regions of interest of the video sequence and the advertising clips to ensure a continuity of salience between the two, thereby optimizing the visual impact of the advertising clip on the spectator.
* The method involves generating salience maps for the video sequence and the advertising clips, determining a degree of similarity between the maps, selecting the advertising clip with the highest degree of similarity, and inserting it into the video sequence at a point corresponding to a shot change or other predefined point.

<summary>
• The invention relates to the use of a recessed mask structure to prevent localized high electrical fields at intersections in very small dimension semiconductor devices, resulting in lower electrical breakdown and improved reliability.
• The problem of high electrical fields at intersections is caused by the facetted region where conductive regions intersect with the surface, producing pointed locations with high electric field concentrations.
• The invention solves this problem by positioning a mask member below the surface to be planarized, at a location where the surfaces of the regions separated by the dielectric are undisturbed, to reduce lateral leakage current and lower the effective dielectric constant.
• The recessed mask structure is achieved through a unique process that permits both the benefit of having a recessed surface of the mask with respect to a device surface and the benefit of having a final mask thickness that is selectable and no thicker than necessary.
• The invention provides several beneficial features, including minimizing damage to the conductive liner, reducing the overall capacitance, and providing faster signal propagation in the interconnect wiring.
• The invention can be integrated into a component to provide a lower and predictable overall capacitance, making it valuable for high-speed and high-density integrated circuit applications.

<summary>
* The Downconverting Digitizer is an analog-to-digital converter that uses predictive coding principles to sample and downconvert a modulated intermediate frequency (IF) signal to baseband in-phase (I) and quadrature (Q) components.
* The converter consists of an analog section, a digital section, and a mixed-signal section, with the analog section minimized to allow maximum use of digital signal processing techniques.
* The predictive filter element is a critical component of the converter, generating a prediction of the modulated IF signal at the next sampling epoch, and filtering out quantization noise while increasing the word length of the digital representation of the signal.
* The converter offers several advantages, including high dynamic range, low power consumption, and low cost, making it suitable for use in radio frequency (RF) receivers and other applications.

<summary>
* The invention relates to active solid-state devices, specifically to apparatus and methods for making and using sensors with nanodimensional features that respond to molecular compounds, organisms, or gas molecules.
* The sensors use nanowires and nanotubes for label-free, direct, real-time detection of biomolecule binding, which can affect the entire cross-sectional conduction pathway of the nanostructures.
* The invention uses nanoimprint lithography to define groups of semiconducting nanotraces between electrodes, which can be used as a sensor or for multiplex detection of analytes when anchored probe molecules are covalently coupled or synthesized to the surfaces.
* The nanotraces have a high surface-to-volume ratio, making them sensitive to changes in their local environment, and their response is proportional to the degree in which the electrical current is influenced by changes in the electric field strength near the surface.
* The fabrication process involves depositing a semiconducting active layer, patterning it into parallel nanotraces using nanoimprint lithography, and etching the nanotraces to create a set of parallel nanotraces over the interdigitated finger region of the source and drain electrodes.
* The drain electrodes are deposited and patterned to provide electrical continuity between the drain electrode stub bonding pad and the drain electrode layer, and to electrically isolate the drain electrodes from the underlying layer.
* The invention enables the fabrication of arrays of semiconducting electrode "nanotraces" in a controllable and regular pattern in a single processing step, allowing for detection of gases adsorbed on the semiconductor surfaces or multiplex detection of many simultaneous detection zones.
* The binding of complementary targets to the anchored probe molecules in the vicinity of the semiconducting active layer produces a change in electrical conductivity of the semiconducting active layer that can be monitored externally for each sensor device in the array in parallel.

<summary>
* The present invention relates to a method of singulating and plating semiconductor packages, involving plating of the side surfaces of the leads of the leadframe to prevent contamination of the lead surfaces.
* The method involves providing a plurality of semiconductor dies coupled to a single common leadframe, singulating the plurality of semiconductor dies, and plating the exposed side surfaces of the leads with a plating material.
* The plating material is preferably a material configured not to react with oxygen, such as tin, silver, gold, nickel-gold, nickel-palladium, or nickel-palladium-gold.
* The singulation process can be performed using full cutting or partial cutting, with the latter involving multiple cutting operations to complete the singulation of the semiconductor packages.
* The partial cutting process can result in a step being formed on the side of the semiconductor package, depending on the thickness of the cutting blades used.
* The finished individual semiconductor packages have side surfaces formed from the molding compound, with the leads of each leadframe being accessible to electrical coupling via the plating material over the portions of the leads that are exposed from the molding compound.

<summary>
* The invention relates to a dual mode mobile terminal that can selectively connect to a wireless wide area network (WWAN) and a wireless local area network (WLAN), and a method for switching between the two networks.
* The mobile terminal has two network modules: a first network module for connecting to the WWAN and a second network module for connecting to the WLAN, which can receive service information from the WLAN about neighboring WWAN base stations.
* The service information is used to select a serving base station when the mobile terminal switches from the WLAN to the WWAN, allowing for faster connection setup and reducing the likelihood of dropped connections.
* The invention provides a method for the mobile terminal to select a serving base station of the WWAN based on the service information received from the WLAN, and to switch between the WLAN and WWAN based on signal strength and other factors.

<summary>
• The invention relates to a new process for producing multilayered electrical components, such as capacitors, coils, and resistors, using a decal-based method that eliminates the need for cutting and laminating individual layers.
• The process involves forming electrodes and electrical components on decals, which are then stacked and fired to form the final component, with the electrodes and components being precisely registered and interconnected.
• The decals are prepared with a release agent and guide posts to ensure accurate registration, and the electrodes and components are formed using screen printing or other deposition techniques.
• The invention allows for the production of smaller, more complex components with lower voltage ratings, and eliminates the risk of internal delamination and cutting stress cracks.
• The process is adaptable to a wide range of electronic devices, including multilayer ferrite inductors, multilayer substrates with buried metal circuitry, semiconductor packages, and precision registers.
• The invention offers numerous advantages, including reduced labor costs, increased precision, and the ability to produce a wide range of components with varying configurations and sizes.

<summary>
• The invention relates to cellular materials used in structural applications, specifically hierarchical lattice structures and methods of using and manufacturing them.
• The lattice structures comprise unit cells of various sizes connected together to form a lightweight lattice structure with improved specific stiffness and strength.
• The unit cells can be of different orders, with higher order cells having larger ligaments and lower order cells having smaller ligaments.
• The cells can be nested and mated to form a hierarchical lattice structure, with higher order cells abutting lower order cells along at least a substantial portion of their length.
• The lattice structures can be used as the core of a sandwich panel or other structure, with face sheets attached to the top and/or bottom of the core.
• The lattice structures can be fabricated using various methods, including injection molding, casting, and deposition of materials.
• The materials used to construct the lattice structures can include metals, metal alloys, inorganic polymers, organic polymers, ceramics, glasses, and composite derivatives.
• The lattice structures have various applications, including use in transportation, ballistics, blast and impact impulse mitigation, thermal transfer, multifunctional structures, armors, and construction materials.
• The lattice structures can be designed to control the collapse of cells during impact, making them suitable for impact or blast energy absorption.
• The lattice structures can also be used as a support system for catalysts, and can be designed to have high surface energy for deposition of thin film batteries or other materials.

<summary>
* The invention relates to a process for co-producing power and hydrocarbons, which integrates an Integrated Gasification Combined Cycle (IGCC) facility with a Coal-to-Liquid (CTL) hydrocarbon synthesis facility, allowing for the efficient production of power and hydrocarbons from coal.
* The process involves gasifying coal in both the IGCC and CTL facilities, producing synthesis gas and combustion gas, which are then used to generate power and produce hydrocarbons through Fischer-Tropsch synthesis, with the ability to recycle hydrogen and CO2 to optimize efficiency and reduce emissions.

<summary>
• The invention relates to a method for preparing a solid device for use as an oxide superconducting material, particularly for improving the properties of the material at the surface or portion close to the surface.
• The method involves coating a blocking film (passivation film) over the spaces or micro-holes in the surface portion of the superconducting material to prevent the removal of oxygen and maintain the superconducting state.
• The blocking film is formed using a photo-CVD method, which provides superior stepped coverage, and can be made of insulating materials such as silicon nitride, aluminum nitride, or oxidized metals like aluminum, titanium, or copper.
• The film is then heat-treated to convert it into a highly dense insulating material, and oxygen is added to the surface or portion close to the surface of the superconducting material using methods like ion injection or hot oxidation.
• The resulting device has a highly reliable surface, with no oxygen deficiency, and can be used to fabricate Josephson elements or other superconducting devices with long-term stability and high reliability.

<summary>
* The present invention relates to an apparatus for preparing foam sheet samples for microscopic examination, which allows for the precise cutting of thin, parallel-sided strips of foam material without damaging the delicate cell structure, enabling the examination of the cell structure and properties of the foam material.
* The apparatus consists of a base plate, support columns, a clamp bar, and a threaded member with a hand nut, which work together to hold the foam sample in place and advance it in precise increments, allowing for the cutting of uniform samples with parallel edges, and enabling the examination of the foam material's properties and performance criteria.

<summary>
• The invention relates to seismometers, particularly those designed for ocean floor operation, and provides a method and apparatus for determining the angle of inclination and leveling seismic motion detectors.
• The invention addresses the problem of seismometers landing in an unknown position on the ocean floor, which can affect the quality of seismic data collected.
• The invention uses a pendulum arrangement to automatically level the seismic motion detectors, ensuring they are properly aligned for operation.
• A plunger is used to lock the detectors in place, preserving their orientation and allowing the angle of inclination to be determined later.
• The plunger is spring-loaded and is restrained by a pin, which is removed by a solenoid to allow the plunger to extend and lock the detectors.
• The invention provides a simple and inexpensive method for determining the angle of inclination of the seismometer, which can be used to improve the quality of seismic data.
• The invention also provides good acoustic coupling between the ocean floor and the seismic detectors, ensuring accurate data collection.
• The invention can be used with a variety of seismic motion detectors, including geophones and other types of detectors.
• The invention is designed to be used in conjunction with on-bottom seismometers, which are used in oil and gas exploration and other geological research applications.

<summary>
• The invention is a humidity sensing element that uses a porous dielectric coating on an aluminum electrode, with nickel particles deposited in the porosity, and a second electrode formed by vacuum deposition of nickel on the dielectric coating. The impedance between the electrodes varies linearly with relative humidity when excited by a suitable alternating current voltage.
• The sensing element is manufactured by anodizing the aluminum electrode, depositing nickel particles in the porosity of the anodized layer, sealing the layer, and then depositing a second electrode of nickel on the sealed layer. The element is suitable for use in a wide range of temperatures and humidities.
• The sensor has a fast response time of around 1 second, is physically sturdy, and is not affected by fingerprints or dirty environments. It is also non-hygroscopic, meaning it does not attract or collect moisture, and can be excited by a low voltage from solid-state electronic instrumentation.

<summary>
* The invention relates to a motor assembly, specifically a force transmission structure, for a window lift system in a vehicle.
* The traditional design has a shaft coupled to a drive plate via a cylindrical coupling end, which generates vibration and noise due to reverse forces exerted on the shaft.
* The present invention provides a force transmission structure with a drive plate having a mounting hole with at least three sections, and a shaft with a toothed portion fittingly received in the mounting hole.
* The drive plate has a coupling formed at its center, which is deeper than the body in the axial direction, and the mounting hole is formed in the coupling.
* The coupling has buffer holes between adjacent sections of the mounting hole to aid molding and reduce distortion.
* The drive plate has protrusions on one side that engage with a driving member, and the shaft has a pinion that drives a driven member.
* The motor assembly includes a motor, a gear train, and the force transmission structure, which transmits rotation of the motor to the drive plate and then to the shaft.
* The invention provides a stable and quiet operation, with reduced vibration and noise, and can withstand greater torque.
* The drive plate is preferably made of an engineering plastics material, and the damper is made of rubber.

<summary>
• The invention relates to a method and system for generating a mobile time reference for a portable transceiver, particularly in a WCDMA (Wideband Code Division Multiple Access) system, which is used to detect, identify, and monitor multipath signals.
• The system uses a free running counter that generates a mobile time reference using a high frequency clock (30.72 MHz) and maintains it using a low frequency clock (32 KHz) when the high frequency clock is not available, ensuring a continuous and accurate time reference.
• The mobile time reference is used in a multipath signal receiver to recover and track incoming clock information, correct phase, and demodulate the signal, allowing for efficient detection, identification, and monitoring of multipath signals in a WCDMA system.

<summary>
* The invention relates to a helmet liner that can be custom-fitted to an individual's head and can be refitted to accommodate changes in head size.
* The liner consists of multiple layers of elastic thermoplastic sheets with arrays of open and unfilled pockets that can deform in response to compressive contact with adjacent layers.
* The layers are arranged in a superposed contacting relationship, and the pockets do not need to be in register with each other, simplifying the manufacturing process.
* The liner is fitted to an individual's head by heating the sheets to a plastic state, placing the liner between an outer fixture and the head, and allowing it to cool and set in a rigid, non-plastic state.
* The liner can be refitted to accommodate changes in head size by reheating the sheets and re-forming them to the new head shape.
* The invention eliminates the need for drawstrings or other tensioning means during fitting and does not require trimming after fitting.
* The liner is simple and inexpensive to manufacture, and its compliance and ability to conform to the contours of the head minimize the tendency for the helmet to shift position on the wearer's head.

<summary>
• The invention relates to a multiorifice structure and method of fabrication, particularly for use in fuel injector valves for internal combustion engines, which provides improved atomization of fuel through angularly disposed passages.
• The structure is made by fusing concentric layers of solid rods and cylindrical members, with each layer of rods disposed at a progressively larger angle with respect to the axis of the assembly, and then slicing the assembly into thin wafers to form the multiorifice structure.
• The resulting structure has triangularly shaped orifices that are more effective in atomizing the exiting fluid than circular orifices, and the method of fabrication allows for precise control over the size and uniformity of the orifices, making it suitable for high-volume, low-cost production.

<summary>
• The invention relates to a method of manufacturing a semiconductor device, particularly an insulated gate (MOS) field effect semiconductor device having a lightly doped drain (LDD) structure, which improves the controllability of the width of the oxide portion on the gate sidewall and prevents degradation of the transconductance and increases of the resistances of elements such as the gate electrode due to hot-carrier injection.
• The method involves forming an insulating film on a gate electrode, forming a conductive layer on the insulating film, anisotropically etching the conductive layer to leave a portion thereof on the gate sidewall, and forming a high concentration region of the source/drain using the gate electrode and the conductive layer portion as a mask, resulting in an LDD structure with improved characteristics.

<summary>
• The present invention relates to Internet telephony and provides an improved end-user interface for IP telephone communication, offering a low-cost and efficient solution.
• Conventional IP telephones have several disadvantages, including the need for high-performance PCs, extra sound equipment, and long boot-up times, which are addressed by the present invention.
• The invention provides an enhanced radio telephone that can be connected to a PC and used as an improved IP telephone, allowing for selective operation as either a conventional radio telephone or an IP telephone.
• The enhanced radio telephone includes an internal speech coder and decoder, which allows for low power consumption and reduces the need for a high-performance PC, and can be connected to a PC via a serial or parallel port or wirelessly using IR or shortwave radio techniques.
• The invention also provides alternative embodiments where the enhanced radio telephone can communicate directly with a network, eliminating the need for an external PC, and can be used for wireless data communication to carry IP speech.
• The present invention offers several advantages, including convenience, economy, and efficiency, and can be implemented in various ways depending on the cost and performance requirements of a given application.

<summary>
* The invention relates to devices that produce electrical power, pressurized water, or other useful work from surface waves on a water body.
* The invention uses one or more submerged gas-filled containers that expand and contract in response to overhead wave-induced hydrostatic pressure differences.
* The containers are connected to a hydraulic or pneumatic pumping means or mechanical or electrical drive means to produce power.
* The invention enhances energy capture by using partial evacuation or surface venting of the containers, which increases the stroke and efficiency of the device.
* The invention also uses overhead surface floating bodies connected to the containers to further enhance energy capture.
* The device can be oriented vertically, horizontally, or at an angle to capture both heave and surge wave energy components.
* The invention overcomes the limitations of prior art devices, including low energy capture efficiency, high cost, and limited depth adjustability.
* The invention uses a reinforced flexible bellows container with a fixed and moving surface, which allows for greater stroke length and energy capture.
* The device can be moored at a fixed depth and adjusted for tides and severe sea states, and can be used in a variety of ocean environments.
* The invention has the potential to produce high amounts of power, with a typical device producing 0.25-1 MW of electrical power.

<summary>
* The invention relates to scraped surface heat exchangers and specifically to the mounting of blades onto a central drive shaft.
* The blades are typically mounted using pins that are welded onto the drive shaft, and the blades are hingedly connected to the pins.
* The blades are installed on the drive shaft at an angle, and then pivoted to a shallower angle to fit within the outer tube of the heat exchanger.
* The problem with this design is that the blades can swing outwardly and fall off the pins during installation, especially in vertically oriented heat exchangers.
* The invention provides a solution to this problem by using L-shaped locking tracks on both sides of the blade that interfere with the pins to prevent longitudinal movement.
* The tracks have entry tracks and intermediate tracks that guide the pins into place and prevent the blade from sliding off.
* The design ensures that the blade can only be installed with the correct side facing up and that it will stay in place even when pivoted to different angles.
* The invention provides a secure and reliable way to mount blades onto a drive shaft in scraped surface heat exchangers, making installation and maintenance easier and more efficient.

<summary>
* The invention relates to a process and apparatus for detecting and eliminating defective and/or incorrectly positioned cigarettes in a cigarette magazine of a cigarette-production and/or cigarette-packaging machine.
* The detection process uses an optical checking element, such as a camera, to scan an image of a plurality of cigarettes in the magazine, which is then evaluated by an image-processing device to detect any deviations from a reference image or value.
* If a defective or incorrectly positioned cigarette is detected, an error signal is produced, which can trigger an ejecting unit to eject a plurality of cigarettes located in an ejecting zone assigned to the unit.
* The ejecting unit has a housing, a linear cylinder, a carriage, and an ejector with a front wall and a rear wall, which are displaced to eject the cigarettes into a chute.
* The invention can also be used to register defective cigarettes, such as those with missing filters or bent or broken cigarettes, and can be triggered manually or automatically.
* The combination of automatic detection and ejection of defective or incorrectly positioned cigarettes can help to avoid disruptions in the production sequence and reduce waste.

<summary>
* The invention relates to a device for interconnecting high voltage cables with apparatus and/or other high voltage cables, featuring a cable termination and a rigid insulator, and provides a simplified connection system for cables with ratings up to 400 KV and above.
* The invention offers a common cable connection system for all accessories and interconnections, with advantages including factory pretesting, reduced installation time and cost, reduced tools, and simplified field testing, as well as the elimination of gas or oil leaks and explosions.
* The invention features three interface methods (inner cone, outer cone, and no cone or slight inner cone concepts) and various applications, including SF6 terminals, transformer terminals, outdoor terminals, straight through joints, transition joints, and joints between apparatus, with benefits including compact design, lower material and installation cost, and enhanced safety.

<summary>
* The invention relates to a fixing mechanism for a tool in a machine tool, comprising a combination of a tool, its frame, and a tool holder, which can be applied in various technologies, including machining, robot applications, and production.
* The fixing mechanism features a curved surface on at least one of the connecting surfaces in the tool frame and tool holder, which allows for a simple and secure fixing of the tool by a movement defined by the curved surface.
* The curved surface is designed to transmit machining force between the tool frame and tool holder in the mounting direction, and can also transmit loads in a direction perpendicular to the mounting direction through frictional contact.
* The invention provides an improved fixing mechanism that is simpler and more secure than prior art, with reduced costs and complexity, and can be used in various applications, including cutting, punching, molding, and forming work.

<summary>
• The invention relates to switching circuitry for driving display drivers, particularly for high-speed operation with low electromagnetic interference (EMI) output.
• Conventional charge pump circuits and switching regulator circuits have limitations, such as low current driving capability and high EMI generation, respectively.
• The invention provides a modified switching regulator circuit that cancels out radiated noise by creating multiple circuit paths carrying electric current in opposite directions.
• The circuit includes additional terminal lines that act as RF antennas to pick up and cancel any leaking EMI fields generated by the outermost paths.
• The invention enables the production of sufficient current to drive large digital displays, such as those on Apple iPhone and iPod Touch products, without generating high EMI radiation.
• The circuit configuration includes interleaved source and drain paths, which cancel out EMI generated in each path, and optional terminal paths that absorb any remaining EMI.
• The invention provides a high-efficiency switching regulator with low EMI emissions, suitable for use in portable electronic devices such as media players and smartphones.

<summary>
• The document describes a method for balancing and charging a battery pack in a plug-in hybrid electric vehicle (PHEV) or battery electric vehicle (BEV) to achieve a target drive range. The method involves determining the maximum capacity of each cell, the common voltage needed to support the target drive range, and the charge time for the battery pack.
• The method also involves determining the resistive circuitry activation time for each cell and balancing the cells by activating the resistive circuitry and enabling the battery charger. The algorithm then deactivates the resistive circuitry for each cell once its activation time has expired and determines whether the battery pack charge time has expired.
• The method can be implemented using a processing device, such as a battery charger or controller, and can be delivered in various forms, including software, hardware, or a combination of both. The algorithm can be used to optimize the charging and balancing of the battery pack to achieve the target drive range.

<summary>
• The invention is an AC-to-DC converter that converts an AC input voltage to a constant DC voltage at a predetermined value set by a potentiometer, providing a constant brightness light that reduces eye fatigue and prevents myopia.
• The converter includes various components such as input protection circuit, EMI filter, rectifier, filter, converter, output filter, lamp, start circuit, control circuit, biasing circuit, sampling circuit, output protection circuit, feedback and dimming circuit, and input monitor circuit.
• The invention can be used in various applications such as bus AC to DC converter, PFC converter, computer power supply, TV power supply, monitor power supply, notebook adapter, LCD TV, AC/DC adapter, battery charger, power tool charger, electronic ballast, video game power supply, router power supply, and ballast.

<summary>
• The invention is a lighting maintenance system that controls the illumination levels in a space using both daylight and artificial lighting, and reduces sun glare. The system consists of a central processor, dimming panel, photosensors, and motorized window treatments.
• The system can be programmed to create custom preset scenes for different activities, and can be controlled manually using wall stations or automatically using photosensors and an astronomical time clock.
• The system can be designed and set up using a personal computer, and can control up to 512 zones and 544 scenes, making it suitable for large facilities.

<summary>
