• Jade struggles with her new responsibilities at the ranch, including cleaning stalls and helping with horse care. She has a hard time connecting with the horses and is resistant to Georgie's attempts to teach her.
• Dash escapes from his stall, and Amy is upset with Jade, who she thinks is responsible. However, it's later revealed that the stall door was tampered with, and Dash's escape was not Jade's fault.
• Ty and Scott investigate the poachers and find evidence of their baiting stations. They also encounter the poachers themselves, and Ty gets into a physical altercation with them.
• Bob, a wildlife reserve owner, is revealed to be in cahoots with the poachers and has been lying to Ty. Ty is angry and feels betrayed by Bob's actions.
• The episode ends with Georgie and Jade showing Jack and Lou the evidence they've found, and Jade finally starting to connect with the horses and take her responsibilities seriously.

<summary>
• The episode starts with Ted telling his children the story of how he met their mother, but this story is about how he dated a girl named Natalie, who he had previously broken up with on her birthday via answering machine.
• Ted decides to call Natalie after three years and apologizes for his past mistake, and they start dating again. However, Ted soon realizes he's not in love with her and wants to break up with her again.
• Ted's friends advise him to be honest with Natalie and tell her the truth, but it doesn't go well, and she breaks up with him in a violent manner, using her Krav Maga skills.
• Meanwhile, Robin is struggling with her job as a news anchor and is humiliated on live TV when she falls and gets covered in horse manure.
• The episode ends with Ted reflecting on the experience and realizing that sometimes, no matter how hard you try to do the right thing, things can still go wrong, but it's all part of the journey to finding true love.
</summary>

<summary>
* Raj's parents set him up with a girl named Lalita, but things don't go well on their date, and she ends up leaving with Sheldon instead.
* Raj gets drunk and reveals that he can talk to women, specifically Penny, and decides to stand up to his parents and not marry Lalita.
* Sheldon's antics cause chaos throughout the episode, including leaving with Lalita and singing "To Life" from Fiddler on the Roof at Penny's restaurant after having a few drinks.
</summary>

<summary>
• The scene opens with Sheldon drawing a hypothetical containment field for a Frisbee-sized wormhole, which sparks curiosity among his friends about his daily 20-minute disappearance.
• Howard and Raj investigate Sheldon's daily routine and discover that he goes to a secret room in the basement, where they suspect he might be doing something unusual.
• Meanwhile, Leonard becomes jealous when Penny starts spending time with a new friend from school, Cole, who has an English accent, and tries to warn him off by pretending to be a tough guy.
• Howard and Raj try to figure out the significance of the number 43, which they found in Sheldon's secret room, but to no avail.
• They eventually set up a camera to spy on Sheldon and discover that he is working on a wormhole generator, which he uses to travel to parallel universes.
• The episode ends with Sheldon revealing that he uses his daily 20-minute break to recharge and do something he enjoys, which is playing keepie-uppie with a beanbag, and that the number 43 is a personal significance to him that he won't share with his friends.
</summary>

<summary>
* The episode revolves around Sheldon's decision to end his internet show "Fun with Flags" due to balancing issues with his career and personal life, but later decides to revive it after receiving a comment from a fan. Meanwhile, Leonard, Howard, and Raj clean out a deceased professor's office and discover a mysterious notebook that they try to decipher.
* The episode also features Bernadette's struggles with being perceived as mean and intimidating, and her efforts to change her behavior, as well as Penny's attempts to help her. The episode ends with Sheldon visiting LeVar Burton to share the news about reviving his show and proposing a new episode idea.

<summary>
• Caroline Forbes is struggling to cope with her mother's death and is considering turning off her humanity to escape the pain, despite Elena's warnings.
• Bonnie Bennett returns from the 1903 prison world and reunites with Damon, bringing back a mysterious picture and a video recording of a woman who is revealed to be Damon's mother.
• Jo Laughlin gives Kai her magic to save his life, and he reveals that she is pregnant, leading Alaric to propose to her.
• Stefan tries to talk to Caroline about his feelings, but she has already made up her mind to turn off her humanity and breaks Elena's neck to prevent her from interfering.
</summary>

<summary>
* Veronica Mars is hired by Mindy O'Dell to investigate the death of her husband, Dean O'Dell, which was ruled a suicide, but Mindy believes was a murder.
* Veronica and Mac investigate a case of a stolen monkey, Twenty-Five, from a lab at Hearst College, which is believed to be the work of the animal rights group PHAT (People for Humane Animal Treatment).
* Veronica and Mac go undercover at a PHAT meeting, where they meet Bronson, the chapter president, and Darla, who seems to be involved in more radical activities.
* Veronica's father, Keith, is also investigating Dean O'Dell's death and discovers that the dean's suicide note was typed on a computer, which makes him suspicious.
* Veronica sets up a meeting with Ed Argent, a conservative rocker, to get close to him and gather information, and she and her friends pose for a photo with him wearing a "Meat is Murder" sweatshirt.
* Veronica and Mac are invited to a secret meeting with Sam, a PHAT member, which suggests they have been accepted into the group and will be involved in more radical activities.

<summary>
* J.R. is angry and frustrated, feeling like he's stuck between his loyalty to his father and his own desires, and Tad tries to offer him some advice and guidance.
* Babe is struggling with her feelings for Richie and her past with J.R., and her mother Krystal tries to offer her some support and wisdom.
* Hannah, who has been causing trouble for Kendall and Zach, escapes and is on the run, with Zach vowing to take her down if she threatens his family again.
* Colby helps Dre, who is in hiding from his politician father, by offering him a place to stay in the Chandler Mansion tunnels.
* Ryan is recovering from being shot and is grateful to be alive, and Annie is by his side, trying to take care of him.
* Hannah, still on the run, meets up with Sean and they share a romantic moment, while Kendall and Zach are dealing with the aftermath of Hannah's actions and trying to keep their family safe.

<summary>
* The episode revolves around the wedding day of Bianca and Reese, but things don't go as planned. Greenlee calls off her wedding to Ryan, and Kendall discovers that Reese and Bianca are staying in Pine Valley, which upsets her.
* Meanwhile, Annie tries to stop Ryan from marrying Greenlee, and Aidan intervenes to help. The episode ends with a dramatic cliffhanger as Greenlee's motorcycle flies off a cliff to avoid Kendall's car.</summary>

<summary>
* Annie is back at Oak Haven and Dr. Sinclair is trying to get her to confess to killing Greenlee, but Annie denies any involvement.
* Ryan is desperate to find Greenlee and is convinced that Zach is responsible for her disappearance, while Jesse tries to calm him down and investigate the accident.
* Kendall is filled with guilt and regret over her argument with Zach, which led to Greenlee's accident, and is lashing out at Bianca and Reese over their secrets and lies.
* David is being his usual manipulative self, trying to get Amanda to give him access to Little A and making threats about revealing her secrets to J.R.
* The search for Greenlee continues, with the police finding her motorcycle and a piece of her clothing, but no sign of her body, leaving everyone to wonder if she's still alive.

<summary>
• Amanda quits her job at Fusion after J.R. tries to get her to sign over custody of their unborn child, and she later moves in with Jake and Tad, who offer her a place to stay.
• Krystal marries David Hayward, despite Tad's attempts to stop her, and signs a prenuptial agreement that may have implications for her future with David.
• Meanwhile, Adam and Erica discuss their business dealings, and Adam tries to come to terms with J.R.'s independence, while Jake and Amanda bond over their shared experiences and Tad tries to move on from Krystal.
</summary>

<summary>
*Tad tries to ask Lysistrata out on a date, but she turns the tables and starts analyzing him instead. They eventually connect and seem to have a spark.
*Erica confesses to Chris that she has been cheating on him, but with her business, not another man. Chris is upset but they seem to be working through their issues. Meanwhile, Jack is still trying to drive a wedge between them.
*Laurie wants to go to college, but her father is resistant to the idea. She eventually tells him she hates him and storms out. Meanwhile, Jamie is accused by Adam of hiding JR, but Jamie denies it and the two get into a heated argument. </summary>

<summary>
* The episode revolves around the aftermath of Krystal's accident and the custody battle for Little A, with David trying to get custody and J.R. trying to keep him away from his son.
* Meanwhile, Kendall is torn between her feelings for Ryan and Zach, and her mother Erica tries to advise her to make a choice and fight for her marriage.
* The episode also shows Opal scattering Greenlee's ashes at the beach, and Ryan trying to move on with his life by getting a new kitten for Emma, but Zach confronts him, ready to deal with him "man to man".
</summary>

<summary>
* Erica confronts Ethan about his lies and tries to convince him to stop pursuing Kendall, but Ethan is determined to marry her.
* Greenlee and Kendall argue over Ethan's intentions, with Greenlee trying to expose his lies and Kendall defending him.
* Jack and Reggie try to help Lily, who is struggling to cope with what she saw at the stable, and Reggie tries to get her to focus on her school project.
* Braden is revealed to be the real killer, and Lily identifies him as the one who hit Edmund with a shovel.
* Jack and the police search for Braden and Jonathan, and a warrant is issued for Jonathan's arrest.
* Greenlee tells Kendall that Lily identified Braden as the killer, which means Ethan lied about Zach's involvement.
* Kendall is torn between her love for Ethan and her doubts about his honesty, while Greenlee tries to convince her to see the truth.
* Erica threatens to do everything in her power to stop Ethan from marrying Kendall, but Ethan is confident that he can win Kendall over.
* Reggie and Lily work on her school project, and Kendall shows up at their doorstep, desperate for answers.
* The police are closing in on Braden and Jonathan, and Greenlee is worried about Ryan's safety.
</summary>

<summary>
* Annie has a breakdown and becomes agitated when Aidan suggests that Tori, a person she claims is her friend, doesn't exist.
* Erica visits Adam, who is hiding out at her place, and tries to convince him to return to the hospital, but he refuses.
* J.R. and Tad search for Adam, who is wanted for kidnapping, and eventually find him at Erica's.
* Colby is worried about her father, Adam, and enlists Pete's help to search for him.
* David performs successful heart surgery on Ian, and Kendall and Zach are relieved.
* Reese visits the hospital and runs into Ryan, who is still bitter about her past actions.
* Aidan tries to help Annie remember her past and suggests that Tori may have been a real person from her childhood.
* Tad tries to convince Jesse to drop the kidnapping charges against Adam, citing that he's not a threat to Little Adam.
* Adam returns to his family and business, determined to take down David Hayward and save Chandler Enterprises.

<summary>
* Erica Kane proposes a reality TV show to Louisa and Carmen, offering them protection and anonymity in exchange for their participation, and reveals that she has made a deal to get Carmen out of prison.
* Greenlee visits Ryan at the beach house, where they discuss their past and Ryan's memory loss, and she ultimately decides to return to Aidan and try to make their relationship work.
* Meanwhile, Jack and Zach investigate Erica's plans and try to uncover what she's up to, while Kendall and Aidan deal with the aftermath of his proposal to Greenlee and Annie considers filing for divorce from Ryan due to his memory loss and her concerns for their daughter Emma's well-being.
</summary>

<summary>
• Annie and Ryan discuss their marriage and Ryan's memory loss, with Ryan asking Annie to hold off on filing for divorce and give him more time.
• Greenlee confides in Zach about her feelings for Aidan and asks for his help in winning him back, but Zach is skeptical and questions her motives.
• Jesse tells Jenny's story to her daughter, including how they met and became friends, and how Jenny was a brave and special person who didn't care what others thought.
• Erica visits Carmen in prison and tries to convince her that she can help her get out, but Carmen is skeptical and thinks Erica is out of touch with reality.
• Greenlee and Zach have a heart-to-heart, and Zach eventually agrees to help her win Aidan back, acknowledging that Aidan makes her happy.
• Erica refuses to give up on Carmen and vows to do whatever it takes to get her out of prison, despite Carmen's initial skepticism.
• The episode ends with Jesse reflecting on Jenny's legacy and the impact she had on those around her, and Kendall visiting Erica in prison and worrying about her safety.

<summary>
• The scene opens at Angie and Jesse's wedding, where three stories of love collide, including Greenlee and Aidan's secret, Tad's search for his daughter, and Jesse and Angie's reunion.
• Robert Gardner, Tad's uncle, appears and takes Angie hostage, leading to a shootout at the wedding reception, where Julia is shot.
• Meanwhile, Greenlee discovers Aidan's infidelity with Kendall and confronts him, leading to a confrontation with Zach, who tries to comfort her.
• Julia's condition is critical, and Krystal tries to convince her to have surgery, but Julia refuses, knowing it would only be temporary.
• Jesse and Frankie work together to take down Robert, and Jesse ultimately decides not to kill him, choosing instead to let him face justice.
• Julia passes away, surrounded by Krystal and Dixie, and Krystal promises to take care of Kathy.
• Tad is critically injured and is airlifted to the hospital, where his condition is uncertain.
• The episode ends with Greenlee turning to Zach for comfort, and a cliffhanger involving Tad's fate.</summary>

<summary>
• Kendall is held captive by Ricky, who reveals his true identity and motives, and she tries to escape and fight back.
• Griffin Castillo, who is alive and has been working to clear his name, arrives and helps Kendall, and together they expose Ricky's crimes and get him arrested.
• Bianca and Marissa are rescued from Ricky's clutches, and they are safe and sound, with Marissa grateful to J.R. for his support.
• Tad reveals to Cara that Griffin is alive and has been working to prove his innocence, and Cara is relieved and grateful to see her brother again.
• Kendall and Griffin are finally able to put the past behind them and look forward to rebuilding their lives, with Griffin's innocence proven and Ricky behind bars.</summary>

<summary>
• The episode revolves around the aftermath of Tad's shooting and the revelation that Kathy is actually Kate, his long-lost daughter. Adam's role in keeping the truth from Tad is exposed, and he faces consequences from Tad, Krystal, and Erica.
• Ryan struggles with his memories and feelings, particularly regarding Annie and Greenlee. He remembers his past with Annie but is unsure if his feelings for her were real. He also has a heart-to-heart with Greenlee, who is still in love with him.
• Meanwhile, J.R. is angry and hurt by his father's actions and seeks revenge against Richie, who set him up with a hooker. Babe tries to intervene and prevent J.R. from doing something reckless, while Krystal and Tad focus on rebuilding their relationship and moving forward with their new family.
</summary>

<summary>
• Jamie is arrested for possession of drugs, and Reggie is also involved in the situation.
• Kendall tries to convince Bobby to seduce Greenlee to get back at Ryan, but Bobby is hesitant and wants more information.
• David wants to be a good father to Babe and Bess, but Krystal is skeptical of his intentions.
• J.R. and Babe discuss their relationship and the fact that they haven't been intimate in a while, with J.R. attributing it to their busy schedules.
• Reggie and Jamie's actions are motivated by a desire to protect people from a drug dealer, Seth Phelps.
• Derek is torn between his duty as a police chief and his role as a father, and Livia advises him to listen to his daughter and trust her.
• J.R. reveals to Babe that he knows Seth Phelps from high school and thinks he may be behind the drug that was slipped to Babe at SOS.
• Kendall's plan to use Bobby to get back at Ryan is put on hold, and Ryan and Greenlee discuss a potential business deal with Bobby.</summary>

<summary>
* Annie and Scott are planning their wedding, but Annie's enthusiasm and Scott's willingness to give her everything she wants raise some red flags. Meanwhile, Marissa is struggling with her marriage to J.R. and her failed bar exam, and Krystal advises her to take a hard look at her marriage and consider leaving J.R.
* Greenlee helps Ryan's daughter Emma by embroidering a special message on a new dress, and Ryan is grateful. However, David becomes jealous and confronts Ryan, accusing him of trying to win Greenlee back. Greenlee and Krystal have a heart-to-heart about their experiences with David, and Krystal warns Greenlee to be careful.
* Caleb Cooney is revealed to be a complex character with a past as a high-powered attorney. He helps Marissa and gives her advice, and he also sells Cortlandt Electronics, but not to J.R. He and Krystal seem to have a budding friendship, and he uses her bar as an office.

<summary>
* The scene opens with Taylor visiting Dr. Jake Martin for a foot exam, and they engage in a flirtatious conversation. Meanwhile, J.R. Chandler tries to convince Krystal to help him acquire Fusion, a company co-owned by Kendall and Greenlee, so that Babe can run it.
* The episode also follows other storylines, including Annie's departure from Fusion, Amanda's decision to wear a pirate costume to impress Jake, and Randi's reluctance to model due to her past experiences. Additionally, Frankie is blackmailed by Fletcher, who is demanding money in exchange for not revealing Randi's secrets.</summary>

<summary>
* Jamie and Amanda are together, but Amanda's behavior towards Babe is causing tension in their relationship.
* Julia Santos is in hiding and being pursued by Kevin Sturgess and his associates, who are trying to kill her.
* Ryan Lavery is alive and in hiding, and is being helped by Erin and Jonathan.
* Greenlee is trying to convince Kendall to divorce Zach and have a baby with her, but Kendall is resistant to the idea.
* Di Kirby (also known as Dixie Cooney Chandler Martin) is being questioned by Tad about her past and her connection to Kevin Sturgess.
* Zach Slater is trying to find Julia Santos and is working with Mimi to track her down.
* Babe is working with Zach to uncover Di's secrets and is still in love with J.R.
* Julia is trying to reconnect with her godson Sam and is telling him about her past and her love for Noah.
* Ryan is trying to protect Jonathan and Erin, and is determined to keep them safe from harm.

<summary>
* Damon tries to cheer up Colby, who is upset about her mom's investigation into Ryan's involvement in David's death.
* Asher tries to impress J.R. by hacking into Caleb's schedule and providing him with information about his meetings.
* Greenlee confesses to Kendall and Bianca that she was involved in the embezzlement scheme and that she asked David to keep Erica away from the Miranda Center.
* Kendall is angry and hurt by Greenlee's confession and feels betrayed by her friend's actions.
* Ryan is in jail and Madison visits him, promising to stand by him despite the circumstances.
* Caleb is struggling to come to terms with his past and his new role in Pine Valley, and Krystal tries to offer him support and encouragement.
* The autopsy results reveal that David was poisoned, and Greenlee is shocked and devastated by the news.
</summary>

<summary>
* J.R. and Babe try to get information about Dixie's disappearance from Alfred, a bank employee, and eventually succeed in getting her financial records.
* Greenlee visits Erin, Ryan's sister, and they bond over their shared grief and memories of Ryan.
* Tad and Zach investigate Dixie's disappearance and suspect Garret Williams, Mimi's husband, of being involved.
* Di and Julia are being held captive by Garret, who is trying to get a letter that incriminates him.
* Mimi refuses to believe that her husband is involved in Dixie's disappearance and resists Tad and Zach's efforts to investigate him.
* Josh advises Babe to be careful in her dealings with J.R. and not to sacrifice her own life for her son's sake.
* Adam is furious with J.R. for getting the company back, but in the process giving half of it to Krystal, his wife, in the divorce settlement.

<summary>
* Bianca is torn between her feelings for her husband Edmund and her lingering feelings for Zach, and she confides in her mother Erica about her emotional turmoil.
* Ryan Lavery is shot at again, and Kendall is accused of being the shooter by Greenlee, who is struggling with her own sanity; meanwhile, Ethan is arrested and tries to escape, but is caught and taken back to jail.
* Tad Martin is determined to uncover the truth about his son Jamie's involvement in the kidnapping of Babe's son, and he enlists the help of his father Joe and private investigator Aidan to track down Jamie and bring him to justice.

<summary>
* The scene opens with various characters getting ready for a charity gala, including Frankie, Randi, Natalia, and Rebecca.
* At the gala, Amanda and J.R. discuss their plan to take down David, while Greenlee and Ryan worry about Annie's whereabouts.
* Meanwhile, Zach arrives at the gala, revealing that Kendall's condition has not improved, and he's brought her back to Pine Valley.
* David makes a bid on a dance with Erica, outbidding Adam, and the two share a dance.
* As the night goes on, tensions rise between various characters, including Frankie and Randi, Krystal and Tad, and Jesse and Angie.
* Annie appears at the gala, holding a bloody knife and declaring that she's ready to get married to Ryan, causing a scene.
* Ryan tries to calm Annie down, but she becomes agitated and starts humming "Here Comes the Bride" as she holds the knife.
* The scene ends with Annie looking down at the knife, and Erica lying motionless on the floor of the ladies' room, suggesting that Annie may have attacked her.

<summary>
• The scene opens with Erin running in the park, where she encounters Aidan, who is suspicious of her brother Jonathan. Meanwhile, Kendall tries to explain to Greenlee why she carried her baby, but Greenlee is devastated and feels betrayed.
• The story unfolds to reveal that Dr. Greg Madden, a fertility specialist, helped Kendall carry Greenlee's baby, but Josh, Greg's son, exposed the truth to Greenlee, causing her to leave Ryan and Kendall. Erica, Kendall's mother, is determined to take down Greg, whom she believes is out to harm her and her family.
• The episode ends with Jack and Erica reaffirming their commitment to each other, despite the chaos caused by Kendall's actions, and Josh vowing to uncover more secrets about his father's past, particularly his connection to Erica.</summary>

<summary>
• The episode revolves around the mystery of who is tormenting Rosanna and setting up Will, with Emily being accused of the crimes. Emily denies the accusations and offers to take a polygraph test to prove her innocence, but the evidence against her seems strong.
• Meanwhile, other storylines unfold, including Lucy and Rafael's rescue from the mine, Alison's loyalty to her sister Emily, and Tom and Margo's attempts to repair their relationship. The episode ends with Emily's future uncertain and Rosanna determined to make amends with Will and Paul.

<summary>
* Gwen and Will welcome Casey back home, but Casey is hesitant to reconnect with his past and is struggling to find a job.
* Brad is recovering from his injury and is being taken care of by Katie, who is trying to avoid his romantic advances.
* Carly is dealing with her sister Rosanna's departure and is feeling guilty for not being there for her.
* Sam is trying to help Carly through her difficult time and is developing feelings for her.
* Jack is trying to make amends with his son Parker and is seeking therapy to work through their issues.
* Casey gets a job at Al's, thanks to his grandmother Lisa, and is trying to start fresh.
* Barbara reveals to Will and Gwen that she has cancer and is trying to make amends with her past mistakes.
* Brad confesses his feelings to Katie, but she freaks out and leaves before he can tell her.
* Carly and Sam grow closer as they bond over their shared experiences and offer each other support.

<summary>
* Casey Hughes is preparing for his wedding to Alison Stewart and is nervous about the big day.
* Mick Dante, who claims to be the reincarnation of James Stenbeck, has escaped from the hospital and is on the loose.
* Alison is seen talking to Mick, who is trying to convince her to run away with him and leave her life in Oakdale behind.
* Paul Ryan is determined to find Mick and kill him for what he did to his wife, Emily.
* Emily is worried about her sister Alison and tries to convince Paul not to take the law into his own hands.
* Barbara Ryan reveals to Henry Coleman that she has been taking a youth serum to regain her youth and that Mick is actually James Stenbeck.
* Henry is skeptical and tries to convince Barbara that she doesn't need to be younger and that she's attractive and sexy just the way she is.
* Paul finds Alison at the church and she tells him that Mick has escaped, but Paul is determined to find and kill him.
* Emily tries to stop Paul from leaving the house with a gun, but he is determined to take matters into his own hands.
</summary>

<summary>
* The episode takes place on Valentine's Day, and various characters are celebrating or dealing with their relationships.
* Maddie helps Will and Gwen evade the police and provides them with a hiding place, while also giving Casey a Valentine's Day gift.
* Jennifer is still grieving Paul's death, but Dusty tries to comfort her and they share a romantic moment.
* Lily takes a pregnancy test and discovers she's pregnant, which Holden is initially surprised by but eventually happy about.
* Carly surprises Jack at the police station and they share a romantic moment, despite Jack's initial reluctance.
* Meg returns to town and finds Paul, who is still alive and in hiding. She is torn between helping him and leaving him to his fate.
* Gwen and Will bond over their shared experiences and Gwen starts to open up to Will about her past.
* Casey is suspicious of Maddie's activities and Nate is revealed to not have a Valentine's Day date.
* The episode ends with Paul and Meg discussing the risks of her helping him, and Jennifer and Dusty reaffirming their commitment to each other.
</summary>

<summary>
*Mick, who is a clone of James Stenbeck, holds Casey, Alison, and others hostage at the church, seeking revenge and trying to expose secrets.
*Alison tries to reason with Mick and eventually offers herself in place of the other hostages, and Mick agrees to leave with her.
*Mick's true identity is revealed, and he struggles with his own morality and the influence of James Stenbeck's programming.
*Casey and the police eventually catch up with Mick and Alison, and Mick is shot and injured in the confrontation.
*The episode ends with Mick's fate uncertain, and the characters dealing with the aftermath of the ordeal, including Alison's guilt and Casey's anger, as well as Henry and Barbara's budding romance.

<summary>
* The episode revolves around Luke Snyder's foundation and its potential partnership with the Starglow foundation, which ultimately falls through due to disagreements over the mission statement. Luke, with the help of Brian, stands up for his foundation's values and decides to continue running it himself.
* Meanwhile, Brad and Katie try to conceive a child with Vienna as a surrogate, but Henry's jealousy and insecurities cause tension in their relationships. Luke's grandmother, Lucinda, is dealing with health issues and is visited by Brian, who offers his support and friendship. Noah and Luke also share a romantic moment, and Luke decides to return to his foundation with a renewed sense of purpose.

<summary>
• Jennifer's press conference for her relaunch of Street Jeans goes poorly, and she's upset about it. Mike tries to comfort her and suggests they celebrate with dinner, but she's too stressed.
• Holden is concerned about Keith Morrissey, who is moving into the guest house, and asks Jack to talk to Lily about it. Jack is hesitant, but agrees to help.
• Alison and Will have a falling out, and she tells him she can't be friends with him anymore. Will is upset and tries to call Jennifer, but she's not available.
• Casey and Celia have a disagreement about Will and Alison's situation, and Casey accuses Celia of trashing Will's reputation without proof.
• Keith and Lily go to a dance, where they run into Holden, who confronts Keith about his past and accuses him of being a deadbeat. Keith denies the allegations and tries to clear up the misunderstanding.
• The episode ends with Holden reflecting on his behavior and wondering if he was motivated by jealousy, and Jack teasing him about being a jealous husband.

<summary>
*Katie and Brad are excited to share their pregnancy news on a reality TV show, but Katie faints on set and is rushed to the hospital.
*The doctor diagnoses Katie with elevated blood pressure and orders her to bed rest for the remainder of her pregnancy.
*Meanwhile, Paul and Rosanna are on the run with Eliza, and they stop at a diner where Rosanna sings to calm Eliza down and charms the diner owner, who offers them food and a place to stay.
*Dusty and Bonnie are hot on Paul's trail, but Bonnie is feeling unwell and they decide to stop and rest for a while.
*Vienna fills in for Katie on the reality TV show and does a great job, and Kim offers her a permanent spot as Brad's co-host.
*Henry is upset about Vienna's new role and feels that she's moving on too quickly from their recent loss, causing tension in their relationship.</summary>

<summary>
• Meg is trying to make amends with Paul and is considering giving him visitation rights to their daughter Eliza, despite Dusty's disapproval. Meanwhile, Rosanna is staying with Paul at Fairwinds and is trying to move on from her past with Craig, who is trying to make amends with Carly.
• Carly is struggling with her own personal demons and is seeking comfort from Craig, who is trying to help her. Rosanna is torn between her loyalty to her sister and her growing feelings for Paul.
• Bonnie is dealing with the aftermath of her night with Dusty, and Derek is jealous and suspicious of their relationship. Paul, meanwhile, is up to no good, hacking into Craig's laptop and uncovering secrets.
</summary>

<summary>
* Barbara reveals that James Steinbeck rented a farm on Route 6, where Paul was taken, and that there was an old well nearby that James used to scare Paul with a nursery rhyme.
* Carly and Jack's wedding ceremony takes place, with many friends and family members in attendance, including Katie, Mike, Molly, and Craig.
* Margo and Holden search for Lily and Rose, following a lead about a hunting lodge with a well, and eventually Margo finds the location with the help of Susan.
* Lily and Rose are trapped in the well, but Rose manages to climb out and goes to find help, leaving Lily behind.
* Carly reveals to Jack that she has a secret, and it is implied that she is pregnant again.
* Mike receives the results of a DNA test, which may reveal the paternity of Sage, Molly's daughter.
* The episode ends with Lily being rescued, and Rose being confronted by Brackett, indicating that she may be in trouble.

<summary>
* Lily has a nightmare about Ethan being hurt, but Holden reassures her that everything is okay.
* Alison and Aaron return to the farm and learn about Ethan's accident.
* Henry finds Vienna and Bonnie trapped in a warehouse and tries to rescue them.
* Paul is stuck in a hole and Mike and his team are trying to rescue him.
* Meg is worried about Paul and tries to convince Mike to get him out faster.
* Barbara arrives at the rescue site and tries to reassure Meg that everything will be okay.
* Ethan is rescued and taken to the hospital, where he is treated for dehydration.
* Meg meets with James Stenbeck, who reveals that he has been behind all the trouble and wants her to sign a document giving him custody of her unborn child in exchange for Paul's life.
* Henry, Vienna, and Bonnie escape from the warehouse and discuss James Stenbeck's involvement in their kidnapping.
* The rescue team is finally ready to pull Paul out of the hole, but it's unclear if they will be successful.

<summary>

* Adam tries to make a deal with Casey to get Maddie to drop the charges, but Casey refuses.

* The court dismisses the charges against Adam, citing the extreme circumstances and the fact that one of the alleged victims, Gwen, has forgiven him.
* Adam is finally free to go home, and he is reunited with his relieved and happy family.
* Janet, still trying to stop Liberty from giving her baby to Paul and Emily, suggests that she and Jack raise the baby themselves, but it's unclear if this plan will work.

<summary>

<summary>

<summary>

<summary>

<summary>

<summary>

<summary>

Stephanie's story is woven throughout the episode, as she says goodbye to those she loves and finds peace in her final moments.</summary>

<summary>

* The episode ends with Stephanie still accusing Donna of the crime, while Donna insists on her innocence and suggests that the real shooter may still be at large.

* Daniel's computer is hacked, and all his files are deleted, including the evidence he had collected to clear Eric's name.
* Anne accuses Daniel of pushing her and files a complaint against him, but Jennifer intervenes and exposes Anne's manipulation.
* Meanwhile, Chyka is seen holding Nicole captive, and Eric arrives just in time to hear her screams for help.
</summary>

<summary>
* Melanie is upset because her father is leaving town and doesn't know when he'll be back, and Chad tries to comfort her.
* Madison James offers Hope a modeling job, which Hope is hesitant about, but Bo thinks it could be a way to get to Stefano.
* Stefano tries to make amends with Chad and offers to help him with his coffeehouse, but Chad is resistant to his father's involvement.
* Sami is working undercover at Countess Wilhelmina to sabotage Kate's plans and help Madison's company, Mad World.

* Bo and Hope are trying to get Stefano to talk to them and are using a plan involving a key to a safe deposit box to get to him.
* Chad and Gabi are asked to meet with Kate, who wants to discuss their future with Countess Wilhelmina, and Melanie is upset about Chad's growing closeness to Gabi.

<summary>
• Mimi confesses to Rex that she had an abortion without telling him, and he forgives her, but Jan Spears threatens to reveal the secret to Rex if Belle doesn't stay married to Philip.

• Meanwhile, Sami is drugged by Eugenia and wakes up to find herself in a compromising position with Brandon, which is part of Kate's plan to sabotage Sami's wedding to Lucas.
</summary>

<summary>
• EJ DiMera is dealing with personal and professional issues, including a conversation with Samantha Brady about their relationship and a business problem in Chicago.
• Nick Fallon is trying to make amends with Sami and others, but they are skeptical of his intentions and don't trust him.
• Theresa Donovan is trying to get her life back on track, but is still involved in shady dealings and is warned by Brady Black to stay away from Daniel Jonas.
• JJ Deveraux is struggling with his own personal issues, including a sentencing hearing and his relationships with his family and Theresa.
• Daniel Jonas and Nicole Walker are working together to clear Eric's name and take down Chyka, but their plan is risky and could put them in danger.
</summary>

<summary>

<summary>

• The episode ends with Billie warning someone (likely Bo) that it will take a long time for Chelsea to forgive them, and Steve and E.J. are mentioned in separate, unrelated scenes.</summary>

<summary>

<summary>

Meanwhile, Rex discovers the truth about his creation and confronts Professor Rolf, who reveals that Stefano Dimera was behind the experiment that created Rex and his sister Cassie.
• Marlena and John's relationship is strained due to John's jealousy and mistrust of Tony, who is trying to make amends with Marlena and their children. Marlena tries to reassure John of her love and commitment to him.
• Belle and Shawn-D are happy and carefree, enjoying each other's company and playfully teasing each other, while Roman and Kate's relationship heats up, and Rex prepares to make a big impact in Salem.

<summary>

* Meanwhile, Ava holds Steve, Kayla, Bo, and Hope hostage, revealing her plan to use Kayla as a surrogate to carry her baby, and threatening to decide who lives and dies once the baby is born.</summary>

<summary>

<summary>

<summary>

<summary>

<summary>

<summary>

<summary>
• The scene opens with Lucas trying to convince Sami to attend her mother Marlena's funeral, but Sami is resistant and blames John, Kate, and Bo for her mother's death.
• Belle is also struggling to come to terms with her mother's death and feels guilty for not being able to save her.
• Shawn is being held captive by Jan, who is trying to keep him from leaving her and is feeding him drugs to keep him complacent.
• Nicole is trying to get Jan to give her money to bail out her friend Crystal, who is in jail for her role in Marlena's "murder".
• At the funeral, Sami lashes out at Hope and Bo, blaming them for her mother's death, and John delivers a eulogy, saying that Marlena's life touched many people and that she will be remembered through the lessons she taught them.
• Belle gives a heartfelt speech about her mother, saying that she was the best listener and that she will always miss her.
• As the funeral comes to a close, Sami refuses to say goodbye to her mother and stays behind to talk to her, saying that she would do anything to hear her say "I love you" one more time.
• Suddenly, Sami hears her mother's voice, saying "Sami, let me out of here", and the scene ends with Sami looking shocked and amazed.
• The episode ends with a preview of the next day's episode, showing Jan threatening Nicole, Nicole flirting with someone, and Sami looking determined to uncover the truth about her mother's death.

<summary>

• Lucas Horton is under house arrest and is struggling with his situation. Sami Brady tries to get him to open up to her, but he remains tight-lipped.
• Ava Vitali is seen at John Black's mansion, and it is implied that she may be helping him with his business dealings.
• Max confronts Dean Robbins, a professor at the university, and reveals that he understands the professor's theories and can point out their flaws. Max also threatens to expose the professor's true nature if Nick's prototype is not allowed to be finished.</summary>

<summary>

<summary>

<summary>

<summary>

• The scene ends with Eric trying to calm Sami down and take the gun from her, while Kristen's fate is left uncertain.

<summary>

<summary>

<summary>

<summary>

<summary>
• The episode revolves around various characters' relationships and personal struggles, including Gabi's decision to give JJ another chance, Chad's unrequited feelings for Gabi, and Abigail's hesitation to reveal herself to Chad after faking her own death.
• Meanwhile, Theo is suspicious of Valerie's intentions with his father Abe, and Sonny tries to help his parents figure out their feelings for each other by locking them in a room together, while Steve and Paul investigate a shipment from Eduardo Hernandez that turns out to be counterfeit designer handbags.

<summary>
• The episode takes place on New Year's Eve, with various characters preparing to celebrate and reflect on the past year. Sami and Rafe are together, and Rafe reveals that he may be reinstated in the FBI, which could help them find Sydney.
• Melanie and Philip are planning to elope to Las Vegas, but Nathan tries to stop them, claiming Melanie is making a mistake. Stephanie also tries to talk Melanie out of it, but Melanie is determined to go through with the wedding.
• Carly is being held captive by Vivian, who is seeking revenge for Carly's role in Lawrence's death. Vivian reveals that she has discovered Carly's secret and threatens to expose it.
• Hope and Justin are searching for documents that could reveal Carly's secret, but they are having trouble finding them. Meanwhile, Victor and Vivian are plotting against Carly and Daniel, who is trying to help Carly.
• Nathan and Philip get into a fight, and Philip is determined to go through with the wedding despite Nathan's attempts to stop him. Melanie ultimately decides to go ahead with the wedding, and she and Philip prepare to leave for Las Vegas.
• The episode ends with Carly trapped and desperate, Vivian gloating over her revenge, and the other characters preparing to ring in the new year with their own celebrations and conflicts.

<summary>
• The scene opens with Luke Spencer, who is recovering from a health crisis, receiving a visit from his friend Ernesto, who brings him a gift of Cuban cigars. Meanwhile, Diane Miller is nominated for "Litigator of the Year" and is preparing for the awards ceremony.
• Sonny Corinthos has been arrested in New York City for assault, and Jason Morgan is trying to find out where he is being held. Carly Corinthos is worried about Sonny and thinks he's lost his head over Kate Howard.
• Ric Lansing is trying to help Skye Quartermaine sell her waterfront properties, but Skye is wary of his motives and thinks he's still seeking revenge against his brother Sonny. Meanwhile, Alexis Davis visits Ric's office and finds him with Skye, leading to an awkward encounter.
</summary>

<summary>
• The scene opens with Johnny and Lulu discussing Dominic's absence, and the christening ceremony of Josslyn Jacks begins. Meanwhile, Sonny shoots Dominic, who is revealed to be his son Dante Falconeri, and Olivia's secret is exposed.
• The christening ceremony continues, and the guests celebrate, unaware of the drama unfolding elsewhere. Carly thanks her guests for coming, and the party continues with cake, presents, and conversation.
• Sonny and Olivia rush Dante to the hospital, where he undergoes emergency surgery. Sonny calls in Robin and Patrick to help with Dante's care, and they agree to do everything they can to save him.
• As Dante fights for his life, Sonny reflects on his past mistakes and the consequences of his actions, while Olivia tries to comfort her son and come to terms with the secrets she's kept hidden for so long.</summary>

<summary>
• Claudia Zacchara tries to make a deal with Jason, offering to give up Trevor Lansing in exchange for Sonny's mercy on her brother Johnny.
• Diego Alcazar holds Sam McCall captive and taunts her, revealing that he is the text message killer.
• Nikolas Cassadine tries to remember the events of Emily's death with her help, and eventually recalls that Diego was the killer.
• Sonny Corinthos is desperate to find his missing son Michael and accuses Johnny Zacchara of being involved.
• Jason tries to negotiate with Sonny to release Johnny, but Sonny refuses.
• Epiphany Johnson attends a "Go Red for Women" support group meeting, where she opens up about her heart condition.
• Maxie Jones and Spinelli try to decipher a cryptic message left by Coop, hoping to uncover the identity of the text message killer.
• The episode ends with Nikolas revealing that he knows Diego is the killer, and Diego responding with a sinister grin.</summary>

<summary>
• Johnny Zacchara is trying to disrupt Sonny Corinthos' organization and is using a Clinton mask to break into Bernie Abrams' office.
• Maxie is drawn to Johnny and Lucky, both of whom have self-destructive tendencies.
• Claire Walsh, a federal prosecutor, is determined to put Sonny away for good and is using Dante Falconeri's testimony to build her case.
• Sonny's trial is approaching, and Carly is worried about Michael's involvement and the potential consequences.
• Jason Morgan is dealing with a threat from Franco, who is sending him cryptic messages and trying to provoke him into making a mistake.
• Spinelli is trying to help Jason track down Franco and is working on a plan to take him down.
• Luke Spencer is trying to protect Ethan from getting involved in Johnny's schemes and is asking Sonny to keep him safe.
• Elizabeth Webber is considering raising her baby on her own and is getting advice from Nikolas Cassadine and Steve Webber.
• Michael Corinthos is feeling guilty about his role in Claudia's death and is worried about the consequences of his actions.
• Lucky Spencer is trying to stay out of the conflict between Sonny and Johnny, but is getting pulled in due to his connections to both men.
</summary>

<summary>
• Todd Manning is arrested by Lieutenant John McBain for jumping bail in Pennsylvania, and Starr Manning is devastated by the loss of her boyfriend Cole and her daughter Hope, whom she blames Sonny Corinthos for killing.
• Maxie Jones is grieving the loss of her friend Robin Scorpio and feels guilty for not being able to prevent her death, while Elizabeth Webber tries to comfort her and encourages her to talk about her feelings.
• Johnny Zacchara tries to use Kate Howard to get revenge on Sonny Corinthos, but Kate is confused and doesn't know what's happening, and Johnny eventually decides not to go through with it.
• Anthony Zacchara tries to manipulate Johnny into sleeping with Kate to destroy Sonny, but Johnny refuses, and Olivia Falconeri tries to help Steve Webber deal with Johnny's blackmail.
</summary>

<summary>
* The episode revolves around the aftermath of the bomb explosion at the hospital, with Jason and Curtis managing to disarm the bomb, and Sam and her newborn baby Scout being reunited with Jason. Meanwhile, Olivia Jerome is revealed to be alive and seeking revenge against Julian, holding Alexis hostage and forcing Julian to choose between killing her or facing consequences.
* The episode also explores the emotional aftermath of the explosion, with Sonny struggling to come to terms with Morgan's death and Carly seeking revenge against Olivia, while Finn begins his journey to overcome his addiction and Hayden stands by him. </summary>

<summary>
* Michael is determined to protect Abby from Brandon, who was released on bail and is threatening to twist the facts to make Michael look guilty. Abby is hesitant to testify against Brandon, fearing that Michael will end up back in Pentonville.
* Luke is consumed by guilt over hitting Jake with his car, and Elizabeth is struggling to come to terms with the loss of her son. Sonny tries to convince Luke that it was an accident, but Luke is determined to take responsibility.
* Suzanne and Theo are reunited and plotting to raise their grandson together, keeping his existence a secret from Brenda and Sonny. Meanwhile, Dante is trying to convince Abby to testify against Brandon, fearing that Michael will take matters into his own hands if Brandon is acquitted.
</summary>

<summary>
* The scene revolves around various characters dealing with their personal struggles and relationships, including Jason and Sam's discussion about having a baby, Carly's fight for custody of Josslyn, and Brenda's adjustment to being a mother to Alec.
* Meanwhile, Shawn agrees to stay on as Josslyn's bodyguard despite Jax's threats, and Kristina confides in Michael about her addiction to hydrocodone and her feelings for Ethan.</summary>

<summary>
* Jason and Sam discuss the possibility that Nikolas staged his own death and framed Jason for his murder, and they start to uncover clues that suggest Nikolas is still alive.
* Meanwhile, Lucas wakes up in the hospital and tries to remember what happened to him, while Dr. Obrecht accuses Dr. Finn of being a drug addict and tries to get him to take a drug test.
* Elizabeth is torn between her desire for revenge against Hayden and her reluctance to team up with Franco, who offers to help her uncover Hayden's secrets, while Jason and Sam prepare to go into hiding to avoid the police and try to clear Jason's name.

<summary>
*Nikolas breaks up with Rebecca, feeling guilty for trying to replace Emily with her.
*Carly tries to follow Michael to his physical therapy session, but Jax convinces her to stay behind and they share a romantic moment.
*Olivia confides in Carly about her affair with Johnny and her concerns about Sonny's reaction.
*Sonny warns Johnny to stay away from Olivia and threatens to take action if he doesn't comply.
*Rebecca tries to convince Nikolas to give her another chance, and he agrees to try to make it work.
*Kristina and her friend Kiefer try to get Michael to drink with them, but Michael gets upset and defensive when Kiefer makes fun of his brain damage.
*Jason is tasked by Sonny to take Johnny with him to deal with some of Zacchara's old guards who are making a move against Sonny's organization.
*Claudia confides in Johnny about her fears that Jason will discover her role in Michael's shooting and plots to take him down.</summary>

<summary>
• The episode revolves around the drama surrounding Maxie's health crisis, as she rejects B.J.'s heart and her condition worsens, while Georgie tries to reach her and say goodbye. Meanwhile, Sonny and Reese's relationship is put to the test as Sonny demands the truth from her about her past and her connection to Carly.
• Other storylines include Nikolas and Emily's struggles with intimacy, Ric's involvement in Evan's death, and Jason's suspicions about Ric's motives, as well as Carly's concerns about Reese and her intentions towards Sonny.</summary>

<summary>
* Patrick and Robin take care of Jake, and Patrick struggles with changing diapers and feeding him.

* Lulu confronts Maxie about her cruel comments about Lulu's mother, Laura, and Maxie apologizes and warns Lulu about the dangers of following in her mother's footsteps.</summary>

<summary>

• Morgan Corinthos is allowed to stay with Kiki Jerome, and Franco Baldwin and Ava Jerome seem to be working together to keep them together, while Carly Corinthos is forced to accept the situation.
</summary>

<summary>
• Patrick is tested for HIV after being exposed to the virus during a surgery, and is put on post-exposure prophylaxis (PEP) as a precaution.
• Sonny has a therapy session with Dr. Lainey, where he discusses his anger issues and his past abuse at the hands of his stepfather, Deke.

• Lucky is struggling with the fact that he didn't kill Manny, and that Jason did, and feels like he's not a hero.
• Carly talks to Sonny about his childhood and his mother's role in not protecting him from Deke's abuse.
• Elizabeth finds out that Lucky has been taking pills and confronts him about it.

<summary>

<summary>

<summary>

<summary>

* Carly is getting ready to marry Sonny, but he is nowhere to be found, and Morgan is worried about his father's whereabouts.

* Meanwhile, Hayden Barnes and Nikolas Cassadine share a moment of intimacy, and Carly's wedding to Sonny is put on hold as Sonny's life hangs in the balance.

<summary>

<summary>
• The scene opens with a chaotic atmosphere in Port Charles, with people struggling to cope with the pathogen outbreak. Jerry Jacks has stolen the antiserum and rigged it to a time bomb, and Alexis is trying to escape from him.
• Meanwhile, Carly is with Johnny, who has been shot, and Todd is trying to make amends with her. Patrick has managed to create a single dose of the antiserum, but it's not enough to save everyone, and Tracy is desperate to get it for her father, Edward.
• As the story unfolds, Jax tries to reason with Jerry, who is dying from radiation sickness, and Sonny arrives to stop him. Monica is trying to follow protocol to distribute the antiserum, but Tracy steals it to give to her father, who then decides to give it to Emma.
• The episode ends with McBain trying to defuse the bomb, Jerry threatening to blow up the antiserum, and Jax trying to stop him. The fate of the characters hangs in the balance as the clock ticks down.

<summary>

<summary>

<summary>

<summary>

<summary>

<summary>

<summary>

<summary>

<summary>

Meanwhile, Marina, who is on police detail, becomes suspicious of Cyrus' activities and eventually discovers his plan.

<summary>

* The episode ends with Lizzie and Bill saying goodbye as she prepares to leave for China, and Bill promising to follow a lead to clear his name and prove his innocence.

<summary>

Meanwhile, Todd tries to get Téa to help him get custody of his kids, but she refuses after they have a one-night stand.

<summary>

Meanwhile, Todd is in the hospital, accused of pushing Marty down the stairs and killing her baby, and Dani is struggling with her feelings towards him.

Rex receives a lead on his biological parents and decides to investigate further.
• The episode ends with Todd trying to convince Dani to give him a chance, but she is resistant to his charms. Téa, who is secretly ill, is determined to help Todd connect with Dani before it's too late, despite Blair's warnings that she is making a mistake.

<summary>

• The episode ends with Michael confronting Dr. Long, who has a heart that he is planning to sell, and David confronting Paul about his treatment of Kelly, who has taken sleeping pills and passed out.

<summary>
• Blair is frustrated with the Chicago Police Department's lack of progress in finding Todd, and John McBain is investigating a lead on a recording that may be connected to Todd's disappearance.

• Cristian tries to apologize to Antonio, but Antonio is too angry and hurt to forgive him, feeling that Cristian's silence was a betrayal of their brotherly bond.
• Nash reassures Jessica that they will find a way to be together and that their love will get her through her illness, despite her guilt over hurting Antonio.</summary>

<summary>

• David Vickers is trying to seduce Viki, but she is not interested, and instead offers him a place to stay in her house as a guest.

• John McBain is trying to help Marty, but she is pushing him away, afraid that Miles will reveal her secret and get John in trouble.
• Clint and Dorian have a fight about her behavior, and Clint tells her he needs some time apart from her.

<summary>

* Meanwhile, Jessica Buchanan has gone into hiding and is communicating with Todd Manning, who is trying to convince Bo Buchanan to put out an APB on her, but Bo is too busy searching for Natalie to get involved.

<summary>

<summary>

<summary>

<summary>

<summary>

Meanwhile, Beth is reluctant to have a DNA test done on her son Marty, which raises suspicions that he may be Sheridan's child.
