Gwen, who has a history of violent behavior, becomes increasingly unstable and threatens to kill Theresa, while Theresa is determined to take her daughter Jane back from Gwen.</summary>

<summary>
* Whitney's water breaks, and she's rushed to the hospital, where she gives birth to a premature baby, causing concern for the baby's health.
* Julian confesses to accidentally starting the fire at the club, which was caused by gasoline cans he had stored there, and T.C. is furious that his daughter Whitney was almost killed in the fire.
* Meanwhile, Charity discovers Tabitha's dark secret: she's carrying a demon child, and Charity tries to warn others, but Tabitha tries to silence her.
</summary>

<summary>
• Spike tries to manipulate Jessica into staying with him, but her family and friends try to intervene and convince her to leave him.
• Meanwhile, Fancy and Chris discuss their relationships and insecurities, and Fancy reveals that she's happy for Sheridan and Chris, but still has feelings for Luis.
• Kay and Miguel find themselves in a romantic, isolated location, courtesy of Endora's magic, and Miguel tries to convince Kay to be with him instead of Fox.
• Theresa and Ethan investigate strange noises and discover that Gwen's mother, Rebecca, and J.T. are hiding on a ledge, trying to keep their affair a secret.
• The episode ends with multiple cliffhangers, including Spike's threat to have Noah arrested, Miguel's proposal to Kay, and Theresa's discovery of Rebecca and J.T.'s secret.
</summary>

<summary>
• Kay and Miguel discuss their plans to get married and raise Maria together, while Fox is devastated by Kay's decision to break off their engagement.
• Rebecca pretends to be Gwen to take care of Ethan, who is unaware that Gwen is not with him, and Rebecca considers taking advantage of the situation.
• Gwen and Theresa try to outbid each other to pay J.T. to keep quiet about Ethan's true paternity, but Gwen ultimately wins.
• Luis searches for Fancy, who is trapped in a cave, and Chris's motives are questioned by Luis.
• Fox receives devastating news from his doctor and decides not to tell Kay, wanting to spare her the pain.
• Theresa plans to expose Gwen and Rebecca's scheme to Ethan, and J.T. agrees to help her.
• Luis risks his life to save Fancy, and the outcome is left uncertain.</summary>

<summary>
* Karen and Colleen discuss decreasing a patient's medication, and Kevin confides in Karen about his drug problem and asks for her help.
* Ian struggles with his vampiric nature and seeks help from Chris, who is supplying him with blood to prevent him from harming others.
* Elizabeth enlists Lucy's help to find Alison, who has been kidnapped by Joshua, and Lucy agrees to use her intuition to track her down.
* Jamal, a newly turned vampire, is confronted by Rafe, who is searching for Alison, and later meets Stacey, who offers to teach him about being a vampire.
* Joshua reveals to Alison that he was friends with her father, Malcolm, and holds a grudge against him for treating him poorly, but denies killing him.</summary>

<summary>
* Sharon tries to convince Victor to help her prove Adam's innocence, but Victor refuses, believing Adam is a psychopath who belongs in prison.
* Leslie tells Adam that the D.A. is moving forward with the trial and plans to seek the maximum sentence.
* Cane's friend Blake is in trouble for not providing a thorough analysis for a project, and Cane tries to defend him.
* Colin, Lily's father-in-law, meets with Lily and Blake, and Blake tries to keep him from seeing the twins.
* Phyllis is worried about Daniel's condition and blames herself for not keeping Daisy in prison.
* The police find a tire tread matching Jana's car near where Daniel was found, leading them to believe Daisy was involved.
* Michael and Jack search for Daisy and the baby, and a surveillance photo shows her crossing the Canadian border.
* Abby tries to stay positive and waits for Daniel to wake up, while Phyllis is consumed by guilt and worry.
* Neil and Sofia are unhappy with Blake's work and plan to fire him.
* Victor warns Sharon to stay away from Adam, saying he's a dangerous man who will bring her down with him.
</summary>

<summary>
* Victor Newman is frustrated and wants to take out his anger on Vance Abrams, who is representing Victoria and Abby in their lawsuit against him.
* Michael Baldwin reviews the forensic accounting report with Victor, which shows that there is no evidence of wrongdoing or mismanagement of funds.
* Abby is worried about the case and feels that her father is trying to manipulate her, but Victoria reassures her that they need to stand up to him.
* Heather Stevens is investigating the drug cartel and wants to know who the secret witness is in the case against Pomerantz.
* Jack Abbott finds a burned-out shack in Hawaii where Skye Lockhart was living, and he finds a bottle of her perfume in the ashes.
* Sharon Newman tells Spencer Walsh about Jack's discovery, but Spencer is skeptical and thinks someone could have planted the perfume.
* Ronan Malloy is revealed to be ill and in need of a liver transplant, and Nina Chancellor offers to be a donor.
* Heather listens to the wire recording from Chance's murder and realizes that the shot that killed him may have been a blank.
* The judge rules in favor of Victoria and Abby, freezing one-third of Newman Enterprises' assets in escrow.
* Victor is furious and warns his daughters that they are destroying the company and their own trusts.

<summary>
• The scene shifts between multiple storylines, including Lily and Tyler getting stuck in an elevator and bonding over their shared fears, Chelsea's meeting with Cane about her fashion designs, and the aftermath of Jamie's accusation against Fenmore for pushing him off a rooftop.
• The episode ends with a confrontation between Jamie, Fenmore, and their parents, with Jamie accusing Fenmore of trying to kill him and Fenmore denying the allegations, leading to a heated argument and a cliffhanger ending.</summary>

<summary>
• Victor's son Nick has arranged for Newman Enterprises to buy Jabot's debt, intending to foreclose and take over the company, which would ruin the Abbott family.
• Jack Abbott finds out about the plan and calls an emergency meeting with the shareholders to discuss a counteroffer to sell 51% of Jabot to Chancellor Industries.
• Nikki Newman is torn between her loyalty to her husband Victor and her friendship with the Abbotts, and decides to call Victor to confirm the rumors.
• Meanwhile, Devon Hamilton is feeling left out and unappreciated by the Winters family, and Lily tries to reassure him that they care about him.
• Phyllis Summers discovers that Malcolm Winters may be Lily's biological father and tries to convince Drucilla to reveal the truth.
• Victor finds out about Nick's plan and is furious, feeling betrayed and humiliated by his son's actions.
• Victor offers to buy Jabot's debt himself, matching Nick's offer, and the bankers agree to sell to him instead.
• Nick is angry and feels humiliated by his father's actions, and the two have a heated argument about their business dealings and personal relationships.
• The episode ends with Jack preparing to put his plan to sell 51% of Jabot to Chancellor Industries to a vote, while Nikki prepares to confront Victor about his actions.

<summary>
• Gloria's plan to scare Lauren and Sharon backfires, and Jack and Sharon decide to leave the mansion, which Gloria and Jeffrey can now have to themselves.
• Alistair, an actor, is hired by Jill and Kay to play the role of John Abbott and win Gloria's heart, but Gloria is still obsessed with her late husband and is not interested in Alistair's advances.
• Victoria and Adam disagree on the direction of the Beauty of Nature campaign, and Victoria becomes suspicious of Adam's motives and loyalty to their father, Victor.
• Meanwhile, Victor is in Los Angeles, where he meets with Sabrina, an art dealer, and becomes interested in her vision for a new art museum in Genoa City, which could be a legacy project for him.</summary>

<summary>
• Detective Chance informs the Newman family that the body found at the Athletic Club is Adam's, and they will need to make arrangements for the body once the medical examiner releases it.
• Jack's wife Patty reveals to Sharon that she found a bloodstained jacket that Nick wore to the ball, and they decide to get rid of it to protect Nick.
• The police search the Newman ranch and find a handkerchief with Jack's initials, which was found in Adam's mouth.
• Owen Pomerantz, the district attorney, questions Jack about the handkerchief and reveals that it was found in Adam's mouth.
• Phyllis tries to cover for Nick by telling Chance that she sent the clothes he wore to the ball to the dry cleaner's, but Chance is suspicious.
• Victor reveals to Owen that the broken watch found at the scene belongs to him and that the blood on it is Adam's.
• Abby meets Ryder, who is revealed to be working with Daisy, and they discuss their complicated family lives.
• Lauren confronts Sheila, who is revealed to be alive and manipulating her children, including Ryder and Daisy, to carry out her revenge against Lauren and her family.

<summary>
• Genevieve is preparing to marry Jack in Las Vegas, but Nikki tries to stop him, warning him that he's making a mistake and that Genevieve is only interested in the company.
• Chelsea gives birth to a baby boy and Victoria and Billy are overjoyed, but Adam's presence causes tension, and Victoria warns him to stay away from the baby.
• Devon's song "Good Goodbye" is a success, and he thanks Tucker for his help in producing it, while Phyllis and Avery discuss their complicated relationships with their fathers.
• Meanwhile, Daniel and Phyllis prepare for the custody hearing, and Daisy plots to keep Lucy away from Phyllis, while Victor tries to pay off Chelsea to leave town and Nikki tries to convince Jack not to marry Genevieve.
</summary>

<summary>
* Genevieve and Victor discuss the sale of Beauty of Nature, with Victor suspicious about Genevieve's funding.
* Lauren and Michael plan to retrieve Fenmore from Canada, while Phyllis is upset about losing custody of Lucy to Daisy.
* Devon celebrates his music success with friends and family, while Harmony and Neil have a disagreement about Devon.
* Victor tries to help Phyllis and Daniel with their custody battle, but it doesn't work out.
* Genevieve proposes a business deal to Tucker, asking him to lie to the S.E.C. about loaning her money to buy Beauty of Nature.
* Lauren is arrested for pulling a gun on Daisy, who had been threatening her.
* Michael receives the news and rushes to help Lauren, while Avery offers to assist him with his work.</summary>

<summary>
• The episode revolves around the anniversary of Nick and Phyllis' wedding, with Nick planning a treasure hunt for Phyllis and their friends celebrating at the office.
• Meanwhile, Victor approves Adam's acquisition of a natural cleaning products company, despite Victoria's disapproval, and Adam and Victoria continue to clash.
• Lily is struggling to cope with her miscarriage, and Cane tries to support her as she returns to work as a model.
• Gloria is upset to discover that Jeffrey is staying with Jill, and Alistair tries to offer her comfort and support.
• The episode ends with various characters reflecting on their relationships and looking forward to the future, including Nick and Phyllis, Victoria and her father, and Adam and his new business venture.
</summary>

<summary>
• Genevieve thanks Ethan for his help, and they discuss her situation with the SEC and her alliance with Victor.
• Ricky tries to make amends with his father Paul, but Paul is skeptical of Ricky's intentions.
• Phyllis reveals to Avery that she's pregnant and engaged to Nick, and Avery offers to help her with her situation with Daisy.
• Lauren's trial is approaching, and Michael and Avery work together to come up with a strategy to defend her.
• Billy and Chloe deal with a messy situation involving Delia and a permanent marker, and Billy later talks to Jill about her confrontation with Genevieve.
• Daniel proposes to Daisy, but she's hesitant and eventually reveals that she's been playing him to get close to Lucy.
• Avery negotiates a deal with Spencer to reduce Lauren's charges, and Lauren is relieved and grateful.
• Paul confides in Avery about his concerns regarding Ricky's character and ethics.
• Ricky is shown to be plotting against Phyllis, determined to bring her down.
</summary>

<summary>
* The episode revolves around the aftermath of the car accident involving Daniel and Cassie, with Cassie recovering in the hospital and Daniel feeling guilty and worried about his future. Meanwhile, Lily tries to help Daniel and Cassie, and Phyllis is dealing with her own problems, including her son's situation and her job at Newman Enterprises.
* Other storylines include Michael trying to make amends with Lauren, Kay trying to play matchmaker for Mackenzie and J.T., and Gloria trying to manipulate her sons to help her with her problems with John Abbott. </summary>

<summary>
• Sharon is struggling with her emotions and feels lost, especially around the anniversary of Cassie's death. She confides in Dr. Watkins about her feelings and her mistakes, including her relationship with Adam.
• Summer's party at the penthouse gets out of hand, and Kyle intervenes when Fenmore gets aggressive with her. Nick is furious and takes away Summer's car keys, while Phyllis tries to reason with him about giving Summer more freedom.
• Michael and Lauren's marriage is on the rocks, and Michael is upset about Lauren's infidelity. Fenmore is also struggling with his own heartbreak and feels like his parents are lying to him.
• Kyle stands up to Nick about his treatment of Summer and expresses his own feelings for her. Jack advises Kyle to be cautious about pursuing a relationship with Summer due to Nick's disapproval.
• Carmine is warned by Paul to stay away from Lauren and to stop stalking her. Meanwhile, Abby is suspicious of Carmine's intentions and warns him about messing with Lauren.
• The episode ends with Nick requesting a paternity-test kit, hinting at a potential storyline involving a character's parentage.</summary>

<summary>
• Kevin tries to convince Chloe to seek help and go to Fairview, but she's resistant at first, still grieving the loss of her daughter Delia.
• Ian Ward is released from prison after the extortion charges against him are dropped, and he taunts Nikki and Dylan, claiming he's innocent.
• Victor and Dylan are angry about Ian's release and want to take matters into their own hands, but Paul warns them against it.
• Avery's web series is interrupted by a creepy comment from someone named 4mj, who is revealed to be Ian, and Dylan confronts him about it.
• Kevin finally convinces Chloe to seek help and she agrees to go to Fairview, with Kevin promising to support her.
• Summer confides in Austin about her mother's coma and her feelings of guilt and helplessness, and Austin shares his own experience of losing his mother.
• Ian is attacked and beaten up, and he accuses Dylan of doing it, but it's implied that Victor may have been involved.

<summary>
• Nick Newman is haunted by the death of his daughter Cassie and blames himself for her passing, feeling guilty for letting her go to a party where she got into a car accident.
• Through a series of flashbacks and visions, Nick sees what his life would have been like if Cassie were still alive, including his family being happy and together, and Daniel and Lily being a couple.
• In the end, Nick comes to terms with his guilt and decides to move back home to be with his son Noah and his wife Sharon, promising Cassie's spirit that he will try to move on and be happy again.</summary>

<summary>
• The scene opens with Michael and Lauren discussing their day, and Lauren expresses her concern about Daisy's hearing and her desire to testify against her.
• Phyllis meets with Daisy and convinces her to fight for custody of Lucy, promising to help her in exchange for her cooperation.
• Meanwhile, Victor's company, Newman Enterprises, is going public, and Michael is handling the IPO.
• Diane shows up at Victor's office, claiming she's pregnant with his child, and Victor is skeptical.
• At the hearing, Daisy testifies about her past and her reasons for giving up Lucy, while Phyllis and Rafe question her motives.
• Jack meets a mysterious woman named Genevieve at the Gloworm, and they discuss the Newman IPO.
• Diane's condition worsens, and Victor takes her to the hospital, where she reveals she's having a miscarriage.
• The episode ends with news breaking that Victor has suffered a stroke, and his condition is unknown, while Jack makes a move to buy Newman Enterprises stock.</summary>

<summary>
* Devon and Elena have a heart-to-heart conversation, and Devon apologizes for paying off Elena's student loans without her consent. They come to an understanding and agree to communicate better in the future.
* Meanwhile, Adam Newman is causing chaos in Genoa City, suing Nick for custody of Christian and manipulating Kevin into doing his bidding. Victoria tries to make amends with Nick, but he's not interested. Kevin is desperate to get Chloe back and agrees to help Adam with his schemes.</summary>

<summary>
• Kevin announces to his family that he's moving to Portland with his daughter Bella, citing the need for a fresh start and to escape the painful memories of his past.
• Chelsea offers Sharon a job at Chelsea 2.0, but Sharon declines due to her busy schedule.
• Nikki returns to Genoa City after a mysterious absence, and Nick is concerned about her health and ability to perform at the upcoming benefit concert.
• Victor is determined to make the concert a success, despite Nick's reservations, and enlists Abby's help with the preparations.
• Kevin's decision to leave Genoa City is met with resistance from his family, particularly Michael, who is worried about Kevin's impulsive decision.
• Nikki reveals to Nick that she had a flare-up of her MS and went to a wellness center in Colorado to recover, and is now determined to perform at the concert to prove to herself and others that she can do it.
• The episode ends with Kevin preparing to leave Genoa City with Bella, and Chelsea running into them and wishing them well, while Victor and Abby finalize the preparations for the concert.</summary>

<summary>
* Colleen discovers that her father, Brad, is being investigated by Paul and JT, and she confronts him about it. Brad claims that it's just a background check done by Victor Newman and that there's nothing to hide.
* Kevin tries to pay off Alex to keep quiet about the tape, but Alex reveals that he made a copy and demands more money. Meanwhile, Phyllis tells Nick that she's decided to raise their baby on her own and doesn't want his involvement.
* JT continues his investigation into Brad's past, talking to a woman who was a neighbor of the Kaplans and found their bodies after they were murdered. She identifies Brad as George Kaplan, the son who was responsible for the murders, in a photograph.

<summary>
* Victoria is considering job offers from Jabot, Beauty of Nature, and Newman Enterprises, and is torn between her loyalty to her family and her own desires.
* Phyllis is fired from "Restless Style" by Billy, who plans to write a salacious article about her arrest and attempted murder charges, and she considers writing a blog to defend herself.
* Adam and Chelsea elope to Kansas and get married, and Adam surprises her with a lavish new home, complete with 10 bedrooms, 12 bathrooms, and a private airstrip.
* Jack Abbott tries to convince Victoria to work for Beauty of Nature, while Ashley accuses him of trying to sabotage Jabot and undermine her authority.
* Phyllis's lawyer Avery advises her to keep a low profile and not respond to Billy's article, while Nick tries to convince her to let him handle the situation and not write a blog.</summary>

<summary>
• The scene opens with Mariah and Tessa discussing their plan to leave Genoa City to find Crystal, Tessa's sister, who is in trouble.
• Meanwhile, Hilary is preparing for her wedding to Devon in the hospital, where she is recovering from a car accident.
• Phyllis, Shauna, Mattie, and Mariah help Hilary get ready for the ceremony, exchanging gifts and sharing emotional moments.
• Devon and Neil have a heart-to-heart conversation, with Devon expressing his gratitude for Neil's support and Neil apologizing for past mistakes.
• As the ceremony begins, Hilary passes out, causing concern among the guests, but she eventually regains consciousness.
• Devon and Hilary exchange vows, with Devon reading a heartfelt passage about his love for her, and Hilary responding with her own declaration of love.
• They exchange rings, using the eternity band Devon gave her years ago, and are pronounced husband and wife.
• The ceremony is a poignant and emotional moment, with the guests aware that Hilary's health is fragile and her time may be limited.

<summary>
* John Abbott is rushed to the hospital after experiencing vision problems and is diagnosed with a minor stroke, causing his family to rally around him and worry about his health.
* Meanwhile, Lily returns home to her parents' arguing and tries to navigate her own feelings about her marriage to Daniel, who is trying to make amends and win her back.
* The Abbott family is also dealing with the possibility of John's sentence being commuted, which would allow him to come home and reunite with his family, but they are also worried about the stress and tension that comes with it.

<summary>
• Jack and Sharon discuss an article about Victor Newman, and Jack reveals that he plans to write a tell-all story about Victor after his death.
• Nick and Victoria are dealing with the aftermath of their father's presumed death, and Victoria is worried about their mother, Nikki, who has gone missing.
• Adam becomes the new CEO of Newman Enterprises and fires Victoria, replacing her with Brad Carlton, which angers Victoria and Nick.
• Jill is dealing with the fallout of an article about David Chow's gambling problem and her role in covering it up, which has led to a lawsuit and a possible SEC investigation.
• Heather Stevens is getting close to Adam and is considering moving in with him, while Paul Williams is searching for Nikki in Mexico.
• The episode ends with Nikki, who is still in Mexico, trying to find out what happened to Victor and refusing to give up hope that he may still be alive.</summary>

<summary>
* The scene opens with Murphy gathering Katherine's loved ones to read letters she wrote before her passing, with instructions to carry out a ritual to help them move forward.
* Victoria is at the hospital, trying to get released to attend Johnny's preschool orientation, and Billy helps her escape.
* Neil, who has recently gone blind, is struggling to come to terms with his new reality.
* The group gathers to read their letters to Katherine, with some being more emotional than others.
* Jill is resistant to the idea, feeling that Katherine is still trying to control her from beyond the grave.
* After everyone has read their letters, they burn them, symbolizing letting go of their emotions and moving forward.
* The group then celebrates Katherine's life with music and dancing.
* Meanwhile, Victor is shown to be working on a secret project involving Phyllis, who is still in a coma.
* Nikki is struggling with her emotions and her MS, and Victor tries to comfort her.
* The episode ends with Jill having a moment of realization and gratitude towards Katherine, feeling that she has finally found happiness with Colin.
</summary>

<summary>
* The episode revolves around various characters and their relationships, including Billy and Amber, Daniel and Colleen, Cane and Chloe, and Michael and Eden, with storylines involving art, romance, and family drama.
* Meanwhile, River is arrested and faces charges related to a murder, and Michael agrees to help Eden, River's daughter, while also dealing with a new lawyer who is representing River in his case.</summary>

<summary>
• Jack resigns from the Abbott-Winters Foundation and blames Billy and Phyllis for his decision, leading to a heated argument with Billy and Ashley.
• Phyllis tries to make amends with Jack, but he refuses to forgive her and tells her to leave their home, ending their marriage.
• Victoria realizes she wants to move forward with Travis and asks him to stay with her and the kids, while Billy begins to confront his demons and consider seeking help for his addiction.
• Meanwhile, Neil tries to help Billy and Jack work through their issues, and Hilary tries to make amends with Devon and Lily, who are skeptical of her intentions.

<summary>
• Damon Porter is in critical condition after a violent incident, and his son Elias appears to him, trying to convince him to let go of his anger and live.
• Michael and Lauren discuss Kevin's challenge to a duel over Lauren, and Michael agrees to fight him to protect her.
• Ashley is devastated after Victor rejects her and tells Brad that she wants to make amends, but Brad is cold towards her.
• Lily confides in Kevin about her trauma after being attacked by Alex, and Kevin tries to comfort her and make amends for his past mistakes.
• Nikki confronts Victor about his feelings for Ashley and is upset that he is still concerned about Ashley's well-being.
• Jack agrees to help Nick hire Sharon at Jabot, but only if Nick covers her salary personally.
• Phyllis is distraught as she watches Damon's medical team try to save his life, and Daniel tries to comfort her.
• The episode ends with Damon's medical team successfully reviving him, and Elias' voice telling him to live and that he will always be with him.</summary>

<summary>
• Chance Chancellor is honored with a commendation for bravery, and his family and friends gather to celebrate, including his girlfriend Chloe.
• Meanwhile, Daniel Romalotti's legal troubles continue, and his mother Phyllis and lawyer Michael discuss the possibility of him fleeing the country to avoid a potential 25-year prison sentence.
• Billy Abbott's relationship with Mac is on the rocks after she discovers he slept with Kelly, and Mac decides to end things with him.
• Ryder Callahan is questioned by Kevin and Daniel about his connection to Deacon Sharpe and the night of the murder, but Ryder insists he doesn't know anything.
• Chloe leaves Chance's celebration to retrieve her purse, which she claims she left at the "Restless Style" office, but Jill suspects she's actually going to try and take advantage of Billy's recent breakup with Mac.

<summary>
• Billy and Victoria discuss her possible pregnancy, and Billy is excited at the prospect of becoming a father again.
• Chloe and Kevin take Delia to a Christmas tree lot, where they meet a photographer who offers to take their photo for a Christmas card.
• Cane and Lily go Christmas shopping with Jill, and they run into Blake, who is working on a project with Cane.
• Phyllis is working on a magazine issue that will expose Sharon's involvement with Adam, and Billy warns her that there will be backlash.
• Daniel visits Daisy, who is living with Phyllis, and they discuss their complicated past and the baby she's carrying.
• Kevin visits Daisy and tries to offer her support, despite her difficult past and current situation.
• Victoria reveals to Chloe that she may be pregnant, and Chloe is upset that Victoria is holding Delia.
• The episode ends with Daniel explaining to Summer that Phyllis is helping take care of someone who is sick and unhappy, and that's why she can't spend time with them.
</summary>

<summary>
• Hilary and Devon reconcile and agree to work together on their show, with Hilary having creative control and a higher salary. They also host a Christmas party at their new apartment, which Jill attends.
• Billy spends Christmas Eve with his sisters Ashley and Traci, despite Jack's disapproval. They exchange gifts and share fond memories of their childhood Christmases.
• Phyllis quits her job at Jabot and agrees to work for Lauren at Fenmore's, where she will develop an online strategy. She's relieved to be leaving Jabot and Jack behind.
• Gloria continues to disapprove of Chloe and Kevin's relationship, refusing to accept Bella as her granddaughter. Meanwhile, Kevin and Chloe are happy to spend Christmas together with Bella, and they're grateful for Esther's support as a grandmother figure.

<summary>
• Adam visits Constance, who is ill, and she reveals that his father's company was stolen from him by Victor Newman, leading to his suicide.
• Faith runs away from home after her parents' breakup, but is found safe at a coffee shop by Dylan.
• Victoria decides to name her daughter Katherine Rose Abbott-Newman, which upsets Billy, who wants his daughter to have his last name.
• Ashley and Stitch discuss their relationships and personal struggles, with Ashley advising Billy to trust Victoria's decision regarding their daughter's last name.
• Nick and Sharon try to make the best of their situation for Faith's sake, despite their differences.
• Joe Clark, representing investors, tries to convince Victor to support his warehouse redevelopment project, but Victor is hesitant.
• The episode ends with Victoria making a mysterious phone call, likely related to a Christmas surprise for Stitch, and Colin and Jill discussing their opposing views on the redevelopment project.

<summary>
• Jill sells Chancellor Industries to Jack, but Billy and Cane advise her to reconsider due to Jack's current situation at Jabot.
• Lily struggles to come to terms with Cane's new life with Sam and Hilary's involvement, and Devon tries to reassure her that Hilary is genuinely trying to be a better person.
• Reed's parents, Victoria and J.T., discuss their failed marriage and its impact on their son, with Victoria encouraging J.T. to fight for his family.
• Nick plans to build a dream home for Chelsea and their family, but Chelsea is hesitant and unsure about the idea.
• Ashley tries to persuade Lauren to help her take action against Jack, who is still working from home despite the board's no-confidence vote, and Lauren reveals she voted for Jack to stay as CEO.
• Mattie tries to stop Reed from driving under the influence, but he refuses to listen and threatens to never forgive her if she calls the police on him.
